Su objetivo es siempre estar dispuesto a trabajar, cubriendo todas las necesidades de su familia y sobre todo de su hija.
texts.en:
Israel lives in Corinto, in the department of Morazán. He is a widower and lives with his daughter, Vicky, 14 years old. Israel grows corn and beans. He learned agriculture from his father 35 years ago. 

He cultivates a manzana [unit of measurement, slightly less than a hectare] of land with corn and beans. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. It would be a big help for him because he would have a new harvest. He will be able to feed his family and will sell the remainder to take advantage of the production. 

His goal is to always be able to work and to provide for his family’s needs, especially for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Collita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLLITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Francisca. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Francisca,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio hace veinte años como, por iniciativa propia, luego fue a un instituto, por obtener el certificado.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de forros, ruedas y trecillas (materaial para la elaboración de las polleras), los que comprará de la ceja y los comercializará en la feria de San Luis. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud
texts.en:
The “Collita” communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and it is directed by its leaders. The leader of the group is Francisca. The businesses of the members differ; among them are sales, production, and services. 

Francisca tells us this is the first loan cycle that she has participated in with Pro Mujer, and she got into the group by invitation. She currently has a business selling traditional skirts. She tells us that she started her business twenty years ago on her own. She later went to an institute to get a certificate.

The loan she will get is for buying lining fabric, rings, and fabric for making the skirts, which she will buy and then sell in the San Luis market. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health [training].

loans.use: to buy lining fabrics, rings, and fabric for making traditional skirts.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a cultivar chile y maíz, también tiene ganado,  tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 9, 11, 18 y 20 años de edad, él desde pequeño se dedica a esta actividad.
Actualmente iniciara la siembra de chiles, para lo que planea comprar 2000 plantas, abono y tratamiento para plagas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir el gasto en el que incurrirá.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente con su familia, para hacerlo es necesario trabajar fuertemente.
texts.en:
Jose lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He cultivates chili peppers and corn. He also has a herd of cattle. He is 40 years old and he lives with his wife and 4 children, aged, 9, 11, 18, and 20. He has been in this business since he was a boy.

He will start his chili plantation, planning on purchasing 2000 plants, fertilizers, and pesticides. He requests a loan to be able to cover the expenses that he will incur. 

His goal is to improve the family's economy and to achieve his goal it is necessary to work very hard.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 chili plants, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, flooring, and doors.

loans.name: Reyson

texts.es:
Reyson es un joven que vive en la zona de Viloma grande a 25 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Sipe Sipe, no se encuentra casado pero vive en concibinato con la joven Claudia y juntos ya tienen un hijito, del cualson responsalbes.

Reyson se dedica a la crianza de conejos y a la carpinteria, su mayor ingreso es de los trabajos de carpinteria que realiza, con materiales de venestas y laminas de madera preparada el construye las cajas para los equipos de amplificacion, practicamente en es un experto en este tipode trabajo, porque muchos de sus clientes viene desde otras localidades alejadas a buscarlo por su buen trabajo.

Reyson tiene una gran demanda de productos por entregar, pero le esta haciendo falta capital para comprar laminas de madera preparada, para ello solicito el credito, el con su actividad de crianza de conejos que recien esta empezando y al cual se dedica su esposa se entero mediante sus vecinos del proyecto Kiva, y pide a los asociados confien en el, y lo apoyen.
texts.en:
Reyson is a young man who lives in the Viloma Grande area, 25km from the city of Cochabamba, in the town of Sipe Sipe.  He is not married, but he lives with his partner Claudia.  Together they have a little boy, for whom they are responsible.

Reyson raises rabbits and does carpentry work.  His greatest income is from his carpentry jobs, in which he uses prefabricated laminated wood to build boxes for amplifier equipment.  He is practically an expert in this kind of work, since many of his customers come from other faraway towns to seek him out because of his good work.

Reyson has a lot of demand for products to deliver to his customers, but he lacks the capital to buy the prefabricated laminated wood.  This is why he is asking for the loan.  He has his work raising rabbits, which he has recently begun, and his partner works on that too.  He found out through his neighbors about the Kiva project, and he asks the lenders to have confidence in him and to support him.

loans.use: to obtain operational capital for carpentry

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La necesidad de generar mayores ingresos para lograr cubrir los gastos familiares impulsaron a Mary Luz A. P. de 24 años de edad a crear su propio negocio, venta de diferentes productos propios para de la elaboración de artesanías, pues en la Ceja de donde es oriunda esta es una gran oportunidad. 

Mary Luz necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido para su negocio, pues actualmente tiene poca mercancía y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para iniciar. Con esta ayuda la joven emprendedora comprará pinturas, aerosoles, brochas, lijas, entre otros. 

En el futuro, Mary espera tener un gran almacén reconocido en el municipio y que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The need to generate a better income to cover the family expenses motivated Mary Luz A. Pelaez, 24, to start up her own business.  She sells products used in the production of handicrafts, because this is a great opportunity in her hometown of La Ceja.

Mary Luz needs a loan to buy products for her business, because right now she has very little merchandise and lacks the capital needed to increase her inventories.  With this help, this young entrepreneur will buy paints, spray paints, brushes, sandpaper, and other items.  

In the future Mary hopes to have a big store that is well-known in her town, which would allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as: paints, spray paints, brushes, sandpaper and other items

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y cultivo agrícola (maíz y frijol), vive con su esposa y tienen una hija de 2 años de edad; él tiene tres años de dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas de 6:00am a 3:00pm, todos los días martes comercializa ganado ya que ese día se ofrecen en el mercado del tiangue la ganadería. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que se dispone a iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todos los insumos necesarios para cuidar del cultivo, le permitirá la siembra de maíz y la posibilidad de tener una buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es sacar a su familia adelante, que su hija crezca y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  He has a business raising and selling livestock and farming (corn and beans.)  He lives with his wife and they have a 2 year-old daughter.  He has been farming for 3 years from 6am until 3pm each day.  On Tuesdays he sells livestock, since on this day there is a livestock market in Tiangue.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers, since he is ready to start planting his corn and bean crops.  This loan will help him to have all of the supplies he needs to care for his crops.  This will allow him to cultivate his corn and have the possibility of a good harvest. 

His goal is to get ahead with his family, so that his daughter can grow up and do well in life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Alpacoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPACOMA” iniciará su décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Catalina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Catalina,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de conocidos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ladrillera, el que viene trabajando hace seis años, conjuntamente su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para invertirlo en su negocio (fabricación de ladrillos), sitió donde trabaja toda su familia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sus beneficios, los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ALPACOMA" is beginning its seventh term through Pro Mujer, at the Villa Exaltación Center.  It is comprised of eight members and has a board of directors that is chaired by Mrs. Catalina.  The communal bank members have different businesses, among which are commerce, production and services.

Mrs. Catalina joined Pro Mujer two years ago by invitation from acquaintances of hers.  Currently she has a brick-making business that she has been working at with her husband for six years.

The loan she is requesting now is to invest in her business (brick-making), where all of her family works.  This type of work lets her generate income to support her family, since she is in a common law marriage and and has eight children.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she says its because of the benefits, savings and training.

loans.use: To invest in her business (brick-making)

loans.name: David Arquimides

texts.es:
David, reside en Semsembra departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado, él vive con su esposa y una hija de 4 años de edad, él aprendió el negocio por su padre, quien le enseño y hoy en día sobrevive de su trabajo al igual que su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, esta inversión le ayudara para realizar el trabajo y cultivar la milpa de maíz  y maicillo.
Los sueños de él es crecer con sus cultivos, también en su ganado, ya que su familia depende de su trabajo por lo que serian los primeros beneficiados con su crecimiento.
texts.en:
David, who lives in Semsembra in the department of Morazán, raises pigs and cattle and lives with is wife and four-year-old daughter.  He learned his trade from his father and makes a living this way just like the rest of his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.  This investment will help him get his work done and to grow corn and millet.

His dream is to expand his crop and livestock business since his family depends on this work and would be the first to benefit by its growth.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Marina Virginia

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de Mina el Limón es soltera, tiene 4 personas a su cargo, incluyendo hija y nietos, los que estudian en los colegios de la localidad, actualmente esta laborando en el centro de salud del mismo poblado, con 22 años de servicios, desempeñándose como Auxiliar de Enfermería , este cliente ha tenido 6 financiamiento con la empresa para desarrollo habitacional, este último es atravez del convenio firmado con el centro de salud de mina el limón ya que los financiamientos combinado con los esfuerzos propios    le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: She is originally from the community of Mina el Limon. She is single and she has 4 people in her care, including her daughter and grandchildren. They are in school in the community. She works at the health care center in the same community. She has 22 year's service working as a nursing assistant. She has had 6 loans from the organization, which were used to improve her home. This new loan is facilitated through the health care center of Mina el Limon. Loans combined with her efforts have helped her to improve her situation and her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, sand, gravel, construction blocks, and to hire a contractor.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, se dedica al destazo de ganado y cerdos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, Carmen lleva cuatro años dedicándose al destazo de animales, la cual realiza una vez por semana, dicha actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar ganado y cerdos para el destazo, otra parte necesita invertirla en la preparación de tierra para sembrar maíz, esta será una gran ayuda para él pues tendrá animales para seguir en su negocio y al mismo tiempo cultivara para la alimentación de su familia.
Su objetivo es darle a su familia un mejor futuro, que sus hijos tengan acceso al estudio y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in Lolotiquillo in the department of Morazan. He is a butcher of cattle and pigs. He lives with his wife and three children, aged, 6, 4, and 1. He has been butchering livestock for four years, working once per week. He learned this business form his father.

He currently needs a loan to purchase cattle and pigs to butcher. He will invest another part to prepare his fields to cultivate corn. This will be a great help for him because he will have livestock with which to continue his business. He will also cultivate for the family's consumption. 

His objective is to provide his family with a better future, so that his children will have access to education and to have an opportunity to improve themselves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
María  es una madre de familia, tiene 30 años de edad, ella es casada con 2  hijos.   Vive en casa propia,  en una  zona rural a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope cuenta con servicios de agua y luz,  el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Maria se dedica desde hace 6  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella suele criar ganado porcino(lechones), ovino(ovejas), pavos y patos; cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

María, está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para que pueda comprar aves menores para engorde con sus respectivos alimentos balanceados.

María es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 30 year-old mother.  She is married and has two children. She live in her own home which is located in a rural area, 15 minutes from Mórrope district.  Her home has piped water and electricity.  She lives in a small community of approximately 100 families.

For six years, María has been raising and selling animals.  She keeps her animals in pens which are located behind her home.  She usually raises piglets, sheep, turkeys and ducks.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the traders who are always visiting her area.

María is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy birds to fatten.  She will also buy feed for the birds.

María is a driven and hard-working person.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective balanced feeds

loans.name: Lilian De Jesús

texts.es:
Después de convertirse en madre cabeza de hogar, Lilian se dedicó a trabajar incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y aunque es madre comunitaria del Instituto de Bienestar Familiar de Santa Bárbara donde tiene a su cargo algunos niños a los que les presta los servicios de guardería se rebusca la manera de generar ingresos adicionales que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello, desde hace algún tiempo empezó a prestar el servicio de lavandería. 

Para continuar con este negocio y esperando ampliar sus clientes, Lilian necesita de un préstamo para comprar una lavadora con mayor capacidad que le permita lavar màs ropa en menos tiempo y así ser más productiva y generar mayores ingresos. 

A sus 48 años de edad, esta emprendedora sueña con poder ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad hasta convertirse en profesionales, por eso trabaja con gran dedicación y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
After becoming the female head of household, Lilian began working tirelessly to improve the lives of her two children.  Although she is a community mother at the Santa Bárbara Family Well-being Institute, where she is responsible for children who she provides day care services for, she was looking for a way to generate additional income that would allow her to improve her quality of life.  She decided to start a laundry service.

To continue with this business and expand her number of customers, Lilian needs a loan to purchase a washing machine with a larger capacity that will allow her to wash more clothing in less time.  This will allow her to be more productive and generate more income.

At 48 years old, this entrepreneur dreams of being able to offer her children the opportunity to study at university and become professionals.  In order to achieve this, she works with great dedication and effort.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, lumber, cement, bricks, sand, posts, fencing and workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows, baby goats, bulls and more cattle.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, reside en San Miguel, vive con su familia, no tiene hijos, y en su familia solo él trabaja, su negocio son las peluquerías, tiene tres locales, donde emplea personal para que labore, están en distintos puntos de la ciudad.
El solicita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en mobiliario para el negocio, ya que la hacen falta gaveteros y sillas para los clientes, esta inversión mejorara el negocio, su vida cotidiana también, ya que estará en mejores condiciones.
El sueño mayor de Miguel es comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in San Miguel. He lives with his family. He doesn’t have children and he is the only working person in his family. He is a barber. He has three locations that are staffed with employees. They are in different parts of the city.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy furniture for his business. He needs storage drawers and chairs for his customers. This investment will improve his business. He lives from day to day and this loan will improve his conditions.
His biggest dream is to own his own house.

loans.use: to buy storage drawers and chairs for his business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene  21 años de edad,  vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el caserío Huascar en el distrito de Tambogrande.  Caserío mediano con deseos de superación.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultora, con mas de 3 años de experiencia.

Mery esta solicita crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus  aves y porcinos, así mismo realizar  asistencia en sus tierras de cultivo para poder vender sus productos a un mejor precio y seguir ampliando y mejorando su negocio. 

Mery es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mery is 21 years old.  She lives in her own home which is located in the village of Huascar, in Tambogrande district.  It is a medium-sized village.

Mery's business is raising and selling animals and poultry.  She raises hens, ducks and turkeys behind her home and, when the animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  She also works as a farmer and has more than three years experience in that business.

Mery is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her birds and pigs.  She would also like to do some work on her farmland so that she can sell her products at a better price and continue expanding and improving her business.

Mery is a driven and hard-working person.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to work her farmland

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita de 38 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Marcelino de 43 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Anita trabaja todos los días en sus tierras, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sean muy productivas, por lo que puede sembrar de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café, y hojas de coca,  ya que estos son los productos que se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantas, lo cual eso reduciría mucho sus ganancias, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su segundo préstamo de Anita con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudar mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mayas por rollo para combatir  los insectos quienes perjudican sus frutos.
texts.en: Anita is 38 years old. She is from Quimbiri City. She is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Marcelino who is 43 years old and her three darling children who she hopes to provide with the best quality of life. Along with her husband, Anita works each day on the land, which, with much effort, has been very productive work. They grow a little of everything. Everything they grow is of good quality. They mainly grow cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves, as these are what they mainly sell in the market. What she most likes about her work is protecting the seedlings from insects that can damage the plants. Damaged plants would greatly reduce her earnings. She has been doing this business for the past 20 years. The most difficult thing about her business is transporting her product to the city of San Francisco. They sell their products in this city. In the future she would like to save her money in order to buy more land. This is Anita’s second loan with MFP. This loan will help her a lot with her business. She is thankful for the institution that provides her with this loan. With this loan she will buy rolls of sticky bug tape in order to combat the insects that attack her fruit.

loans.use: to buy rolls of sticky bug tape in order to trap insects.

loans.name: Kantutas De Cañuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE CAÑUMA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Remedios. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, cría de animales, venta de dulces en colegio, venta de tenis, empleada domestica, costura, cría de ganado, pensión venta de salchipapa.
 
La señora Remedios,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que participa gracias a la invitación de unas vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ganado que lo esta trabajando hace cinco meses. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de ganado vacuno, que comprara de la comunidad de Vilacota del municipio de Achocalla. Cuando este ganado ya pueda ser comercializado lo venderá en las ferias de Achocalla. También comenta que este negocio lo realiza con el apoya de su esposo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las tasas de intereses bajas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kantutas de Canuma" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Villa Exaltacion. It is made up of twelve members and it is managed by a board of directors, led by Mrs. Remedios. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are various, and among them we have: vegetables sales, community store, raising livestock, sweets sales in a school, shoes sales, janitorial services, sewing services, raising cattle, prepared foods sales.

Mrs. Remedios indicates that is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer and she is a member following an invitation for a neighbor. She currently has a cattle sales business and she has had it for five months. 

The loan will be used to purchase a cow. She will purchase it in the community of Vilacota in the municipality of Achocalla. Once the cattle can be sold she will take them to the fairs at Achocalla. She comments that she has this business together with her husband. This type of business helps her generate an income to help her family as much as possible. She is married and she has ten children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the savings and the low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Luz Did

texts.es:
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales, Luz Did de 26 años de edad y oriunda del municipio de El Carmen de Vìboral al oriente de Antioquia decidió crear su propia fuente de empleo, un almacén que ha ido mejorando poco a poco gracias a su tenacidad y ganas de superarse, pues ahora además de obtener sus ingresos genera dos empleos a madres cabeza de hogar, lo que la llena de satisfacción. 

Su gran visión empresarial la ha llevado a soñar con un gran almacén en el que pueda generar muchos más empleos y así aportar al progreso de su comunidad. Por ahora, Luz Did continúa trabajando fuertemente para sacar su negocio adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Due to the lack of employment opportunities, Luz Did decided to create her own source of employment.  She is 26 years old and lives in the town of El Carmen de Viboral to the west of Antioquia.  Her store has been improving little by little thanks to her tenacity and desire to improve.  In addition to the income it generates, it gives jobs to two female heads of households, which fills her with satisfaction.

Her great business vision has lead her to dream of a large store where she can provide many more jobs and contribute to the progress of her community.  For now, Luz Did continues to work hard to improve her business and improve her quality of life.  For now, she needs a loan to make some adjustments to the location of her business.

loans.use: to make adjustments to the location of her business.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es:
Diómedes tiene 54 años de edad, vive con sus esposa y sus 2 menores hijos. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el caserío Pedregal Alto a 7 Km. del Distrito de Tambogrande, no cuenta con servicios básicos. 

Diómedes se dedica a la agricultura, teniendo 1.50 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en el cual cuenta con el cultivo de mango y limón. La plantación está bien conducida y requiere de labores de limpieza y abonamiento. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años, en los cuales ha adquirido experiencia en el rubro. Además Diómedes cuenta con una clientela fija los cuales compran la producción de mango y limón unas ves cosechadas.

Diómedes esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles, los que destinará  para realizar el pago de la obra en la limpieza de su terreno y a la compra de fertilizantes. De esta manera asegurara una buena cosecha.

Diómedes, es un cliente conocido por Edpyme Alternativa cuenta con un buen historial crediticio y con muy buenas referencias de su  responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Diómedes is 54 years old and lives with his wife and their two young children. He owns a house located in the village of Pedegral Alto, which is seven kilometers away from the District of Tambogrande. Diómedes does not receive basic services.

He is a farmer and owns 1.5 hectares of land for cultivating mangos and lemons. His farm is well-managed, but it needs to be cleared and fertilized. Diómedes has been farming for more than 20 years and has gained experience. He also has established customers who buy the mangos and lemons that he harvests.

Diómedes is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN. The money will be used to pay workers to clear his land and to purchase fertilizers. This will allow him to secure a good harvest.

Diómedes is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa who possesses a good credit history. He also has good references who can attest to his responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay workers to clear his land.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de ropa y oro, vive con sus dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, también vive con su esposo, ella comercializa sus productos en todo el oriente del país, visitando los pueblos y cantones, su hijo mayor le acompaña.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir: vestidos, pantalones de ambos sexos, blusas, entre otros, esta inversión contribuirá a mejorar el desarrollo del negocio.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente, ahorrar y compra una vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the city of San Miguel and she sells clothing and gold. She lives with her two children, aged 7 and 5. She also lives with her husband. She sells her products in the entire western area of the country, visiting the villages and communities. Her eldest son keeps her company. 

She requires a loan to purchase articles of clothing: dresses, men's and ladies' pants, blouses, and others. This investment will contribute towards the development of her business.

Her objective is to work very hard, to save money, and to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: La señora Mirtha , es una de las integrantes del grupo comunal Santa Ana, una alcancía formada hace ya 10 años, que tiene como integrantes personas que  luchan cada día  para  mejorar la economía en sus hogares. Una muestra de ello es la señora Mirtha de 37 años conviviente y  madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 a un son menores de edad, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado cerca a su casa, el cual le da tiempo para poder trabajar y educar a sus hijos. Ella  comenzó en este negocio a raíz que la economía en su hogar era demasiada baja y necesitaba de mayores ingresos para poder sustentar gastos como la educación de sus hijos y mejorías para su hogar, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido construir su casa y darles educación a sus hijos, en el futuro le gustaría ampliar mas su puesto de venta de verduras y poder pagar  los gastos de universidad de su hijo mayor. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de verduras para la venta de su negocio.
texts.en: Mirtha is a member of the communal bank named Santa Ana, a communal bank formed 10 years ago. The members are individuals who struggle every day to improve the economy of their homes. A representative is Mirtha. She is 37 years old, married common-law, and she is the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are minors. She sells every day vegetables at a small market near her home. Her business gives her time to work and to educate her children. The root of the reason why she started her business is that the household income was too low and they needed a greater income to be able to cover expenses such as the education of the children and home improvements. With her efforts and hard work she has been able to build a house and to provide her children with an education. In the future she would like to expand her vegetables sales business to be able to pay for her eldest son's university expenses. The recent loan will be used to purchase vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Sonia  es casada  y tiene 46 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en L. alcancía comunal “Amigas Unidas” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Sonia    trabaja desD. hace 15 años en L. venta D. carne D. res y carnero en un mercado, Sonia nos cuenta que empezó este trabajo con L. idea D. sacar a sus hijos adelante, tener mejores imgresos economicos ya que con el sueldo D. su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos D. servicio agua luz alimentacion, Sonia trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en día tiene. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación sus hijos fueron a L. universisad, cuentan con una mejor calidad D. vida y sobretodo es feliz. Su sueño es compararse un terreno. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Sonia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Sonia is married and she is 46 years old. She is a member of the communal bank named "Amigas Unidas". It is a group maD. up of 7 members who all have different business activities. Sonia has been selling beef and ram’s meat at a market for the past 15 years. Sonia tells us that she started this business with the thought of supporting her children and to have a better income. Her husband's wages were not enough to cover the household utilities, including water, electricity, and food. Sonia worked very hard to obtain what she has today. Thanks to her efforts and dedication her children attended university, they have a better quality of life, and above all, they are happy. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land. The loan that has been granted to her is to purchase merchandise. We know that Sonia will reach her goals through hard work and efforts. And the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase beef and ram's meat for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel, de 37 años de edad, es natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa, convive con Mercedes de 29 años de edad y fruto de su relación tienen 02 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Sanabamba anexo del distrito de San Miguel. La labor que realiza Joel es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva cacao, café y frutas cítricas, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno y es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo. Tiene 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y  trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados por medio de vehículos. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son muy productivas permitiéndole obtener buenas ganancias. Asimismo considera que el invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas injertadas como tangüelos y mandarinas.
texts.en: Joel is 37 years old and he is originally from Palmapampa. He is married common-law with Mercedes, 29 years old, and they have 2 children from their relationship. They live together in a house which they own, located in the community of Sanabamba, an annex of the district of San Miguel. Joel works the land where he cultivates cocoa, coffee, and citric fruits. He has 3 hectares of land in total and he is well acquainted with the arduous work associated with the land. He has been in the business for 15 years and during the harvest season has help from farmhands. They are in charge of the harvest and the transportation of the harvested goods to where they will be moved by vehicles. He is very committed to his work because it is thanks to his daily efforts that today he is able to enjoy watching his plants become very productive, earning him a good profit. The winter is not to his liking because during those months there is an abundance of insects that harm his plantations. This is his seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that he if pays it on time he will be able to access another loan with greater ease. He is thankful to the organization for granting him a loan. With the loan he requests he will purchase grafted plants, such as tangelos and mandarins.

loans.use: to purchase critric fruit trees such as tangelos and mandarins.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera sin hijos.  Vive en casa de madre ya que su padre es fallecido, ella vive en el distrito de San José en una comunidad urbana mediana y cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y  energía eléctrica.

Marcela se dedica ala confección de artesanías textiles, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace más de 06 años en la vivienda de su madre, Ella se viene capacitando de manera constante con la finalidad de ofertar mejores productos a sus ocasionales clientes.

Marcela esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles, para que ella pueda comprar materiales necesarios para la confección de sus artesanías, y de esta manera pueda cumplir con la demanda de clientes que actualmente tiene

Marcela es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder ayudar a su madre al sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marcela is 28 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at home with her mother and her father is deceased. They reside in the District of San José, a medium-sized urban community that receives basic services such as water and electricity.

Marcela makes handcrafted textiles. She has been developing her business for more than six years from her mother’s house. Marcela is constantly learning so that she can offer better products to her occasional customers.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 PEN. This will enable her to buy the necessary materials for producing her crafts and meeting the existing demand from her customers.

Marcela is an earnest and hardworking individual. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can help her mother maintain their home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora María,  indica que es el octavo mes que integra en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingreso por la promoción de la asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ají que aprendió hace 10 años de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra condimentos que servirá para surtir su negocio; los que comprará del desaguadero (frontera Bolivia Perú) y los venderá los domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Flor de Rosas" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of the San Andres focal center. It is made up of eleven members and it is directed by a board of directors, lead by Maria. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are various, and among them are: commerce, production, and service. 

Maria indicates that it is the eighth month that she has been in a communal bank with Pro Mujer and she joined following a promotion by the assessor. She currently has a business selling chili peppers, having learned from her mother.

The loan that she will access is to purchase condiments to supply her business. She will purchase in Desaguadero (border between Bolivia and Peru) and she will sell on Sundays. This form of work helps her generate an income to support her family. She is married and she has 5 children.

loans.use: compra de condimentos

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos. Su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, en un pequeño caserío llamado Las Norias.   

Moisés trabaja como obrero dependiente, el cual trabaja para el proyecto especial olmos con un tiempo aproximado de mas de 6 meses,  y además como actividad complementaria realiza labores de agricultura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 8 años en su caserío, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. 

Moisés está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para algunos gastos de construccion en su vivienda, para que de esta manera moises pueda contar con seguridad y comodidad en su hogar.

Moisés es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, y se le conoce como una persona puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Moisés is a 39-year-old father who lives in his own home with his wife and two young children. Their house is located in a small village called Las Norias in the District of Olmos.

Moisés is an employed worker who is currently assigned to a special project in Olmos that will last for more than six months. In addition to this job, he has been farming in his village for more than eight years. He learned how to farm from his father and is known for being a perfectionist.

Moisés is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to pay for some of the expenses related to the construction of his house. This will allow his family to have a safe and comfortable home.

Moisés is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa who is known for being a punctual and responsible person.

loans.use: to pay for home construction expenses.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 28 años, es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Edwin de 32 años y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Marlene desde muy niña trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, con sus ahorros acumulados más la herencia que heredó de sus padres hoy tiene 03 hectáreas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco y ha logrado volverlas muy productivas. Ella cultiva, cacao, café y frutas cítricas, productos que luego lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir con los gastos familiares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales que se encuentran en su comunidad. Por ello contrata jornaleros para que le apoyen. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, porque desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Marlene is 28 years old and she is a young woman who is enthusiastic and hardworking. She lives in a house which she owns together with her partner, Edwin, 32 years old, and their 2 beloved children. She wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Marlene worked her parents’ land since she was a young girl. With the savings she accumulated and her inheritance from her parents today she has 3 hectares of land and she works them with great ardor to make them very productive. She cultivates cocoa, coffee, and citric fruits. The products are later taken all the way to the city of San Francisco where she sells them in wholesale. Her cultivations have been providing her with the income she needs to support herself and to cover the family's expenses. What she most enjoys about her business is to care for the cultivation. She feels very happy doing so. She has 4 years in the business. The most difficult part is to transport the products from the fields to the businesses in her community. For this she hires farm hands to help her. In the future she wants to purchase more land to increase her cultivation. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has the obligation to make her payments on time and she is ready to do so because she wants to access another loan in the future. She is thankful to the organization for granting her a loan. With the loan she requests she will purchase more cocoa plants to graft them and to take good advantage of her products in less time.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Alvaro, el socio tiene 30 años de edad;  el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8, 3 años de edad; el socio es taxista el tiene su unidad de transporte, el socio brinda el servicio de taxi, el socio desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de llantas, combustible y para de ello desea invertir en mejorar su vivienda. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas y mejorar su vivienda con el otro monto que reste.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Virgen de Guadalupe - Cusco". It is located in the district of Huanchac, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

His name is Alvaro. He is 30 years old, married common-law, and he has 3 children, aged, 11, 8, and 3. He is a taxi driver and he has his own car. He provides taxi services. He wants this loan to invest in the purchase of new tires, and fuel, and to invest in home improvements.

He is thankful and he wants to say that he will comply with his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new tires and to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es: Santos Alejandro tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta y compra de ganado. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que  El trabajo al que se dedica es muy pesado pero le gusta, en un principio y hace mucho tiempo empezó esta actividad como aprendiz y con el tiempo aprendió. La pasión que le pone a su trabajo lo ha convertido en un buen  hombre y por ello se ha ganado los reconocimientos de todos los que lo conocen. El siempre está viendo la manera de mejorar su trabajo, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para comprar vacas, chivos, y toros. Pues siempre ha soñado con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: Santos Alejandro is 45 years old and he buys and sells cattle. He has been in the business for more than 16 years. His business is very difficult but he likes it. In the beginning, a long time ago, he started out as an apprentice and with time he learned. The passion he expends in his work has converted him into a good man and this has won him the recommendation of all those who know him. He is always looking for a way to improve his work. For this reason he requests a loan, to purchase cows, goats, and bulls. He has always dreamt of expanding his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows, goats, and bulls.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn P. is from the village of Militar. She is 22 years old, married and has 1 infant. Mylyn owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport to local community members. Mylyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Mylyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the labor cost of tricycle repairs for better services. This will be the first loan taken out by Mylyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle repairs.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson P. is from the village of Sto. Niño. He is 42 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Nelson owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lecibel

texts.en:
Lecibel E. is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Lecibel owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products, making snacks such as chicharon (fried pork rinds) and making garlands and gift bags in the local community. Lecibel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Lecibel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lecibel is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products such as blouses and t-shirts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lecibel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing items.

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Saripa

texts.en:
Saripa is 26 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Saripa has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as noodles, curls, sardines, etc.

Saripa has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items such as sugar, milk, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, Saripa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luzvizminda

texts.en: Luzvizminda is 54 years old and married with five children. She has been raising pigs for 5 years, and has taken out 19 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Luzvizminda has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and pig feed. In the future, Luzvizminda would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 61 years old and married with three children. She has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from charcoal sales. Nenita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia G. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and food supplements, such as multivitamins, in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it. Lilia appears in the photo with her grandson.

In 2008, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional herbal or medicinal products. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal or medicinal products.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 47 years old and married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. Jesusa works very hard to provide for her family.

Jesusa has operated a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as t-shirts, pants, blouses, curtains etc. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic U. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap, biscuits, detergents and beverages in the local community. She also provides motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, instant noodles and beverages. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, instant noodles and beverages.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Crislie

texts.en:
Crislie is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and also earns an income from her boarding house and selling spices.

Crislie has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as sardines, spices, etc. to sell in her general store. Crislie has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running an office and school supplies business for 4 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Ma. Lourdes has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. Ma. Lourdes hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old and married. Nancy owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling blankets, pillowcases, bed sheets and bath towels in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products such as pillowcases and blankets. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as pillowcases and blankets.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Leny works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog fattening and a poultry business. Leny is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her food vending business.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 36 years old and is married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a sari-sari(variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to to buy additional items to sell like candies and sardines in her sari-sari store.

Flora has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream and sugar. 

In the future Flora would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora D. is from the village of Barangay 2, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Rodora owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like siopao, binangkal, nilubid & chicken barbecue in the local community. Rodora has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & to provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs, milk & chicken meat. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs, milk & chicken meat

loans.name: Miljury

texts.en:
Miljury is 38 years old and is married with 6 children.

She has a vegetable farm in the Philippines. Miljury is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for 6 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is married with 7 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emilita is 53 years old and 3 of her children go to school.

Emilita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar and cooking oil for her food vending business.

Emilita has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Emilita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 56 years old and is married with 2 children.

She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like cooking oil and spices.

Nila has previously borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari(variety) store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nila aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her general store

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita works very hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Pepita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Pepita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 49 years old and is married with 2 children.

She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase of additional items for her business.

Nelly has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She has been running the ready-to-wear business for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her ready-to-wear clothes business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 48 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest son and daughter are students while his youngest son attends public school. He supports his family by operating a meat trading business with help from his wife. He is a professional accountant. He worked as an accountant. 

Enkhbold started his meat trading business in 2006. Now he has 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital and he supplies beef tongue and prime beef loin to 24 restaurants. He purchases beef from herders. With this loan of 2,000,000 MNT, he will purchase a large amount of beef from herders during this period when prices are lower.

Enkhbold wants to expand his business and be able to support his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beef

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, tiene 52 años de edad, nació en el departamento de León, esta casada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería, es madre de 4 hijos, pero vive con sus nietos a los cuales ella los cuida. Inicio la venta de productos alimenticios por medio de una vecina que tenia una pulpería, pero después su vecina decidió quitar la pulpería y se la cedió a doña Mercedes así fue ella empezando a vender ,la mercadería se la daba al crédito y poco a poco fue ella pagando su productos .Ella tenían experiencia en venta , ya que desde los 7 años comenzó a vender en las calles ,solía vender tamarindo(fruto) ,artesanías ,después se dedico a vender frutas ,buñuelos, tamales hasta hoy en día que se dedica a atender una pulpería que con esfuerzos propios ha venido manteniendo. Lo único que lamenta es no haber podido estudiar pues las escuelas quedaban muy lejos era muy difícil para ella  y sus padres ponerla a estudiar solo logro llegar hasta cuarto grado de primaria.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como granos básicos, aceite, jabón, productos de limpieza, para abastecer de nuevos y mejores productos su pulpería, ella espera que con esta nueva inversión pueda atraer más clientes, mejorar las ventas, incrementar sus ingresos. 
Con esta inversión ella espera lograr una de sus mas grandes y anhelados sueños componer su casita, hacerle mejoras su pulpería, pues donde ella vive los materiales de que esta hecha su casa es de cartón , plástico, zinc .Su meta próxima es comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 52 years old and was born in the department of León.  She is married, works as a merchant, owns a general store and has 4 children, but lives with grandkids that she cares for.  She started selling food products through a neighbor who had a store.  Later, her neighbor decided to leave the business and passed it on to Mercedes.  That is how she started selling merchandise, buying on credit and paying for her products little by little.  She had experience in sales, having started selling as a street merchant at 7 years of age.  She tended to sell tamarinds (fruit) and handicrafts.  She later dedicated herself to selling fruits, fritters and tamales up until today, when she dedicates herself to her store and has maintained it through her own efforts.  Her only regret is not having been able to get an education, as the schools were very far and it was difficult for her parents to allow her to study.  She only managed to complete school up to the fourth grade.

She requested this loan to buy merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soap, and cleaning products to supply her store with new and improved products.  She hopes that, with this investment, she will be able to attract new customers, improve sales, and augment her income.

With this investment, she hopes to achieve one of her greatest wishes which is to outfit her little house and make improvements to her store since, where she lives, the materials these are made out of are cardboard, plastic, and zinc.  Her next goal is to buy construction materials.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soap, and cleaning products to supply her store with new and improved products.

loans.name: Byron Antonio

texts.es:
Byron, es un  joven de 28 años, originario de Condega ,municipio de Estelí, esta casado, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente,  de oficio agricultor , el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos . Sus inicios fueron duros desde su niñez, lo crio un señor quien le enseño el oficio de la agricultura y ganadería le trabajo durante 8 años ordeñándole a los animales, trabajando y preparando el terreno para siembra. Al tiempo se independizo, se caso con una muchacha proveniente de la comarca Santa Teresa, ubicada el municipio de Condega. Hoy en día vive en esta comarca es ahí donde siembra junto con su esposa, pues el padre de ella le dio esa tierra para que la trabajen.
Realizo el préstamo para sembrar una manzana de frijoles. Con esta inversión el espera sacar una producción de calidad con alto rendimientos que le permita vender esta cosecha a un buen precio. Desea componer su casa, brindarle un techo digno donde puedan vivir sus hijos. Una de  sus metas es poder comprar un terreno para ampliar su siembra y criar animales.
texts.en:
Byron is a 28-year old young man, originally from Condega in the Estelí municipality.  He is married, the father of two children ages 8 and 3, and a farmer.  He had a tough start as a youngster.  He was raised by a man who taught him about farming and raising livestock, and worked for 8 years tending to the animals and preparing the land for planting.  Over time, he became independent and married a woman from Santa Teresa in the Condega municipality.  These days, he lives in this region, which is where he plants along with his wife on land that her father gave them to work on.

He took out this loan to plant a plot of beans.  With the investment, he hopes for a crop that will yield in a quantity that will allow him to sell his harvest at a good price.  He hopes to outfit his house, thereby providing a dignified abode for his children to live in.  One of his goals is to buy some land in order to expand his crops and raise animals.

loans.use: plant a plot of beans.

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es: Marta Magdalena D. sesenta años D. edad vive con su hijo en una casa propia. Ella posee una tienda que poco a poco ha ido abasteciendo D. productos. Marta piensa que cuando trabaja todo el día con esfuerzo una mejor vida para ella y su familia sale al encuentro; siempre esta entusiasta con muchas ganas D. trabajar y esa energía se la transmite a los clientes que la visitan, las personas siempre se van satisfechas porque les da un buen servicio y siempre encuentran en su tienda lo que buscan; es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como golosinas, granos básicos, bebidas, embutidos, jabones entre otros, para abastecer el negocio y no decepcionar a la clientela. Marta tiene confianza que todo su trabajo lograra satisfacer las necesidades D. su hogar y le permitirá en el futuro darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Marta Magdalena is sixty years old and lives with her son in a house she owns.  She has a store that, little by little, she has supplied with products.  Marta believes that, when she works hard all day long, she will find a better life for herself and her family.  She is always enthusiastic and has a great desire to work, and this energy transmits itself to the customers who visit her.  They always leave satisfied, because she offers them quality service and they can find what they need in her store.  This is why she has turned to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy more products such as snacks, basic grains, beverages, cold cuts and soaps, among other items, so she can supply her store and not let her customers down.  Marta has confidence that all her effort will satisfy her household’s needs and allow her to give her family a full life.

loans.use: buy snacks, basic grains, beverages, cold cuts and soaps.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora Elizabeth D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad, viuda, vive con sus dos hijos los cuales aun se encuentran estudiando. Ella posee una tienda que es la más visitada por los clientes, pues está ubicada en un lugar muy concurrido D. personas y además ahí reciben el mejor servicio; siempre está adelante D. su competencia tiene los mejores precios, un lugar muy higiénico y siempre encuentran lo que necesitan; Dinora tiene grandes metas y para ella, mientras más granD. sea su meta más pequeños se vuelven los obstáculos es por eso que le solicita a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas, productos instantáneos, golosinas entres otros; D. esta forma podrá satisfacer a su clientela y al mismo tiempo satisfacer las necesidades D. su hogar. Dinora tiene fe que todo este esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Dinora Elizabeth is forty-three years old, a widow, and lives with her two children who are in school.  She has a store that is well frequented by customers, as she is located in an area with a lot of foot traffic and offers the best service.  She is always ahead of her competition, offering customers the best prices, a clean establishment, and a place where they can find what they need.  Dinora has great goals and, for her, the bigger her dream the smaller the obstacles become.  This is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to supply her business with items such as basic grains, dairy products, beverages, instant products, and snacks, among others.  In this manner, she can satisfy her customer base while concurrently meeting the needs of her household.  Dinora has faith that all her efforts will allow her to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, dairy products, beverages, instant products, and snacks to supply her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
