La señora Elena, nació en la Comarca el Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, tiene 44 años de edad, ella es productora de café, lleva 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos están bajo su cargo . Cuando tenia 20 años se caso con su marido y desde entonces se ha dedicado junto con el a sembrar café con la ganancias producidas ha venido comprando tierras para siembra, también tiene una pulpería en su casa que es otra fuente de ingresos, también ha establecido un huerto de hortalizas tales como pipián, ayote, pepino que lo utiliza para consumo familiar.
Solicito el préstamo para sembrar una manzana de café. Con esta producción espera obtener un buen rendimiento con calidad  de café, vender a un buen  precio que le permita cubrir los costos tales como pago de mano de obra, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes. Ella tiene planeado comprar mas terreno para siembra de café e ir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Elena was born in the Consuelo region, located in the Pueblo Nuevo section of the Estelí municipality.  She is 44 years old and produces coffee, an activity she has carried out for 20 years.  She has 5 children, of whom 4 are in her care.  She married at 20 years of age and her and her husband have dedicated themselves to growing coffee together since then.  With their earnings, they have continued buying farmland for their crops.  She also has a general store in her house, which is another source of income.  In addition, she has established an orchard with vegetables such as squash and cucumbers that they use for the family’s consumption.

She requested this loan to plant a plot of coffee.  With this production, she hopes to obtain a productive yield of quality coffee to sell at a good price and that will help her cover costs such as manual labor, purchase of supplies, and fertilizers.  She has planned to buy more land in order to expand her plantings, and also to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: sow a plot of coffee plants.

loans.name: Soninbat

texts.en:
Soninbat is 42 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts of the city. His daughter attends public school. 

Soninbat and his wife operate a shoe manufacturing business. When they first started their business in 2007, they made shoes at their home. Today their business has grown so that they have 2,600,000 MNT in working capital and they have rented premises. They manufacture traditional leather shoes. With this loan of 2,000,000 MNT, Soninbat will purchase a large amount of leather/material for handmade shoes during this period when the prices are lower.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make handmade shoes

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa Amalia de sesenta años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupusería que lleva por nombre “Rosita”, es una pupusería muy famosa y muy visitada en el lugar pues Rosa les da a las pupusas un sabor inigualable y las vende a un buen precio, además su negocio es muy higiénico y atiende a los clientes como se merecen. Para Rosa el trabajo mas productivo es el que sale de las manos de una persona contenta y trata de transmitirle eso a su clientela; todo su ánimo la impulso a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como  queso, frijoles, chicharrón, loroco, bebidas entre otros para realizar y vender sus ricas pupusas. Rosa tiene la esperanza de que su negocio la posibilitara para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su hogar  y al mismo tiempo este será en un futuro útil para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Amalia is 60 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  She owns a pupusería called Rosita which is very famous and popular as the pupusas Rosa makes have an unbeatable taste and she sells them at a good price.  In addition, her business is very hygienic and she treats her customers well.  For Rosa, the most productive work is that which is produced by the hands of a happy person and she tries to pass this on to her customers.  Rosa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy raw materials such as cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, 'loroco' (a native vine with edible flowers), drinks and other products so that she can make and sell her delicious pupusas.  Rosa hopes that her business will enable her to continue covering her household needs and that it will be useful for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, fried pork rinds, loroco and drinks

loans.name: Adriana Beatriz

texts.es: Adriana Beatriz de veinte años de edad vive con su familia; Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar. Adriana es una joven entusiasta que quiere ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, para ella trabajar todos los días es su inspiración. Últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues da el mejor servicio, siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro y vende sus productos a un buen precio, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como pan, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos entre otros para abastecer la tienda y para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Adriana sueña con que su trabajo le ayude a superarse como persona y también le ayude a darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Adriana Beatriz is 20 years old and lives with her family.  She has a store in her home in which she serves the people in her area.  Adriana is an enthusiastic young woman who would like to help her family get ahead in life.  She is inspired to work every day.  Lately she has had a lot of customers since she provides a very good service.  She always has a smile on her face and she sells her products at a good price.  Adriana would like to see her business grow and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy more products such as bread, candies, drinks, basic grains, etc. with which to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.  Adriana dreams of improving herself as a person and providing her family with a better life through her work.

loans.use: to buy bread, candies, drinks and basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, cereals, candies, basic grains and bread

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, tiene 53años de edad, es originario de la comarca Labranza ubicada en Condega municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor ,es padre de familia de 7 hijos , solo estudio hasta tercer grado de   primaria. El inicio desde temprana edad, conforme paso el tiempo se estableció en la comarca Las Mesas, en Pueblo Nuevo ahí siembra  hortalizas, gracias a esas cosechas pudo comprar tierra , así comenzó a sembrar granos básicos  y posteriormente café de esta manera ha ido creciendo poco a poco trabajando fuertemente con sus hijos también , hoy en día tienen ganado.  
Solicito el préstamo para mantenimiento de café y siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes. Este crédito le ayudara a sacar una buena producción y darle un buen mantenimiento a sus siembras. El planea componer  un pozo, comprar ganado, mejorar la calidad de siembra de café orgánico
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 53 years old and from Labranza, in Condega, Estelí.  He is a farmer and has seven children.  He only studied up to the third year of elementary school.  Maximiliano started farming at an early age.  He went on to set himself up in Las Mesas, in Pueblo Nuevo, where he currently sows his crops.  Thanks to his harvests, he was able to buy land and so started sowing basic grains and then coffee.  His business has gradually grown and he works hard alongside his children.  They now also own livestock.

Maximiliano requested this loan to maintain his coffee crop, to sow basic grains such as corn and beans, and to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers.  This loan will help him to achieve a good production and maintain his crops.  He plans to fix up a well, buy livestock and improve the quality of his crops, with organic coffee.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crop, to sow basic grains such as corn and beans, and to buy supplies, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Inés

texts.es: Sandra Inés D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hijo. Ella tiene una venta D. especies las cuales compra por mayor y después las empaca y las venD. por tiras. Sandra ya posee mucha clientela pues es un producto muy usado en los hogares para preparar comidas exquisitas, además las especies son D. mucha calidad a un buen precio; para Sandra no hay labor pequeña si se hace con entusiasmo y entrega y es así como se animo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más especias como fideos, harina D. pan, orégano, pimienta, entre otros para no decepcionar al cliente y satisfacer sus necesidades. Sandra tiene la esperanza que su  trabajo le ayuD. a sacar adelante a su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Inés is 42 years old and lives with her life partner and son.  She has a business selling spices.  She buys her spices wholesale, puts them in packets and then sells them in strips.  Sandra already has a lot of customers as people use spices a lot to make delicious meals.  In addition, her spices are very good quality and she sells them at a good price.  For Sandra, there is no job too difficult if it is done with enthusiasm and commitment.

Sandra requested a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more spices.  She will buy noodles, bread flour, oregano, pepper and other products so that she can keep her customers happy and meet their needs.  Sandra hopes that her work will help her to get her household ahead and proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bread flour, oregano and pepper

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel, 45 años de edad, originario de la comarca El Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 4 hijos, el es productor de café, lleva 30 años dedicándose a la siembra de café. El comenzó a trabajar a los 12 años de edad sembrando granos básicos como maíz y frijol y ayudaba a su papa a sembrar café, cuando el tenia 18 años de edad compro su propio terreno y el resto de su tierras se las heredo su papa. Hoy en día 2 manzanas las tiene solo para siembra de café, su hijo mayor le ayuda a cultivar. 
Solicito el  préstamo para compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizante, pago mano de obra para la siembra de café. Con esta inversión espera poder vender su producción a precio justo, cubrir los costos, generar ganancias que le permita invertir  seguir trabajando. Quiere seguir mejorando su producción, aumentar aéreas de siembra, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 45 years old, and is from El Consuelo, which is in the Pueblo Nuevo municipality of Estelí. He has four children, and has spent 30 years growing and producing coffee. He started working when he was 12 years old, growing basic foods, such as corn and beans, and he helped his father grow coffee. When he was 18 years old, he bought his own land, and he inherited the remainder of his land from his father. Now, he only grows coffee on his two farms, with the help of his oldest son. 

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizer, which are required to grow coffee. With this investment, he hopes that he can sell his coffee at a reasonable price, cover his costs, and generate earnings that will permit him to invest and continue this activity. He wants to continue improving his production to increase his land available for growing coffee and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers, which are required to grow coffee

loans.name: Marlon Gonzalo

texts.es:
Don Marlon, es agricultor, el siembra café, tiene 30 años de edad, es originario de la comarca el Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es padre de familia, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. El hace 10 años viajo a Costa Rica fue a trabajar y ahorro gracias a eso pudo comprar 3 manzanas de tierra y un terreno donde construyo su casa. Así fue cultivando café poco a poco con ayuda de su señora quien lo ha apoyado desde el principio, cuando se pone un poco baja la temporada de siembra el se dedica hacer trabajos jornales en fincas aledañas. 
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de abono, insumos, pago de mano de obra, insecticida, fertilizantes para la siembra de café. El espera sacar una buena producción de café con buenos rendimientos que le permita vender el quintal de café a un buen precio, así mismo pagar los gastos de producción. Desea seguir sembrando más café, tiene como meta próxima sembrar 1 manzana más de café orgánico.
texts.en:
30 year-old Marlon is a coffee farmer.  He is from El Consuelo, in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.  Marlon has two children aged 8 and 3.  Ten years ago, he travelled to Costa Rica to work and save some money.  As a result, he was able to buy three 'manzanas' of farmland (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres), and a plot of land where he built his house.  He grows his coffee with the help of his wife who has supported him from the beginning.  When work is slower during the sowing season, he works as a day laborer on neighboring farms. 

Marlon requested this loan to buy manure, supplies, insecticides and fertilizers for his coffee crops, and to pay laborers.  He hopes to achieve a good crop of coffee, with good yields which will allow him to sell a quintal of coffee for a good price and cover his production expenses.  He would like to continue sowing more coffee.  His goal is to sow one additional manzana (1.68 acres) with organic coffee.

loans.use: to buy manure, supplies, insecticides and fertilizers for his coffee crop, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Antonia Margarita

texts.es: Antonia Margarita D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hija. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado regional D. la ciudad en que vive y en donD. se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa para niños, niñas, señores y señoritas;  tiene mucha clientela pues el lugar es muy concurrido D. personas todos los días, además la atención que les brinda Antonia es la mejor siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro y les venD. el producto D. mejor calidad a precios accesibles. Antonia piensa que todo aquel que se esfuerza y se entrega a su trabajo siempre tiene una oportunidad y es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más mercadería como vestidos, faldas, pantalones, trajes D. bebe entre otros. Antonia sabe que D. esta forma lograra salir adelante con su familia y podrán mantener una vida digna en su hogar.
texts.en:
Antonia Margarita is 56 years old and lives with her life partner and daughter.  She has a stall in the regional market in her city where she buys and sells children's, men's and ladies' clothes.  She has a lot of customers as the place is very busy with people every day.  In addition, Antonia provides the very best customer service.  She always greets her customers with a smile on her face and sells them very good quality products at affordable prices.  Antonia believes that those who work hard and put a lot into their work always have opportunities.

Antonia requested a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy more merchandise such as dresses, skirts, pants and baby outfits.  She knows that this will enable her to get her family ahead and proviD. them with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts, pants and baby outfits

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Argentina vive con su compañero D.  vida Rodolfo y su hijo. Ella posee un comedor en el cual venD. ricos desayunos y almuerzos; es muy conocida en el lugar pues ella prepara los platillos más exquisitos y los venD. a precios accesibles a sus clientes; para ella la comida se anuncia a la nariz del cliente desD. su cocina. El rico sabor D. sus comidas ha llamado mas clientela últimamente y Argentina quiere estar preparada es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, verduras, pan, bebidas entre otros, así no defraudara a sus clientes y les permitirá seguir degustando D. las ricas comidas que prepara. Argentina tiene la confianza D. que su negocio le dará la oportunidad D. darle a su familia una vida plena llena D. alegrías.
texts.en: Argentina lives with her life partner Rodolfo and her son.  She owns an eatery where she sells delicious breakfasts and lunches.  She is very well known in her area because she makes the most delicious meals and sells them to her customers at affordable prices.  Her food greets her customers from her kitchen.  The delicious flavor of her meals has recently attracted more customers and Argentina would like to be prepared.  For this reason, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL which will enable her to buy more supplies such as basic grains, meat, cold cuts, dairy products, vegetables, bread, drinks, etc.  In this way, she will be able to keep her customers happy and allow them to continue enjoying the delicious meals that she prepares.  Argentina is confident that, through her business, she will be able to proviD. her family with a life full of happiness.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, cold cuts, dairy products, vegetables, bread and drinks

loans.name: Blasius

texts.en:
Blasius is a 30-year-old man who lives in Labat Village. Blasius is married and has been blessed with 4 children namely: 
Martha who is 11 years old and in the 5th grade of elementary school, Anita who is 8 years old and in the 2nd grade of elementary school, Arni who is 7 years old and in the 1st grade of elementary school and John, 6 years old and in kindergarten. Prior to selling bananas, Blasius worked as a truck driver for 4 years. He decided to stop doing this job and then started his banana business with his own capital. Blasius is happy operating this business. 

Blasius said that this business has good prospects for his family income. So, Blasius dreams of improving his business to generate more income. He is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase more bananas to sell in Inpres Market. Blasius hopes that TLM will give him the opportunity to receive a business loan for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas

loans.name: James Santos

texts.es: James Santos de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee  una venta de ladrillos de tejar o manual y es el mejor ladrillo del lugar las personas lo prefieren por su calidad y el buen precio; además el carisma de James al atender a sus clientes es inigualable siempre está a su disposición, personas como albañiles son los que más solicitan sus ladrillos y últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más materia prima como la arcilla, el barro entre otros para la fabricación de mas ladrillos que puedan satisfacer la necesidad del cliente. James espera de esta forma sacar adelante a su familia y confía que podrá darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: James Santos, 42, lives with his partner.  He has a business selling handmade bricks and bricks for tiles and are considered the best bricks in the area.  People prefer their quality and price.  In addition, the way James treats his customers is unmatchable.  He is very attentive.  People who are brick layers use his bricks and he has recently gotten more clients which is why he is taking out a loan from INTEGRAL.  This will help him buy raw materials like mud and other things to produce bricks that will satisfy his customers.  James hopes to get his family ahead by doing this and is confident that he will be able to give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: Raw materials: mud.

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es: María Paula D. cincuenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida, ella posee una tienda en la que venD. productos alimenticios, ya se ha hecho D. mucha clientela la gente la visita porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, les da un servicio excelente y tiene los mejores precios del lugar, siempre está adelante D. la competencia para María la motivación es lo que determina lo que se quiere lograr, y ella está decidida a ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como cereales, granos básicos, bebidas, lácteos, embutidos golosinas entre otras cosas que le ayudaran a satisfacer la clientela. María es una mujer D. fe y confianza que trabajara día y noche para darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Paula is 54 years old and lives with her life partner.  She owns a store where she sells food products and has a lot of customers.  People visit her store because she always has what they need, she provides excellent customer service and she has the best prices around.  She is always ahead of the competition.  María believes that it is motivation that determines what you will achieve and she is determined to see her business grow.

María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy more merchandise such as cereals, basic grains, drinks, dairy products, cold cuts, candies and other products which will help her to satisfy her customers.  María is a woman who is confident that she will work day and night to proviD. her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy cereals, basic grains, drinks, dairy products, cold cuts and candies

loans.name: Roxana Beatriz

texts.es: Roxana Beatriz de veintinueve años de edad vive con su familia. Ella tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras, Roxana es una mujer carismática, llena de energía siempre trabaja desde muy temprano, pues al que madruga Dios lo ayuda; la personas la prefiere porque siempre los atiende muy contenta y su mercadería esta siempre fresca además de los precios accesibles. Sus ganas de ver crecer su negocio la motivaron a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como plátanos, brócoli, tomates, melones, lechuga entre otros que le permitan abastecer su puesto y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, Roxana tiene la esperanza que cumplirá el sueño de sacar adelante a su familia llevando seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Roxana Beatriz, 29, lives with her family.  She has a fruit and vegetable stand.  Roxana is a charismatic, energetic woman who always starts working very early because God helps those who rise early.  People prefer her because she always takes care of them happily and her merchandise is always fresh and her prices are affordable.

Wanting to see her business grow motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will make it possible for her to buy more merchandise like bananas, broccoli, tomatoes, melons and lettuce, among others to stock her stand and meet customer demand.  Roxana hopes to reach her dream of moving her family ahead and providing economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy broccoli, tomatoes, melons and lettuce.

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Corina del Carmen  D. cincuenta y nueve años D. edad, vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella tiene una venta D. ropa D. todos estilos para damas y caballeros; Corina es una mujer emprendedora y sueña con sacar adelante a su familia, últimamente ha tenido más clientela y eso la llena D. satisfacción pues los clientes la prefieren porque les ofrece el mejor servicio, con ropa novedosa a buenos precios; ella quiere que crezca su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, blusas entre otros y D. esta forma satisfacer la necesidad D. los clientes y al mismo tiempo lograr llevar una seguridad económica a su hogar para darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en:
Corina del Carmen is 59 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a business selling ladies' and men's clothes.  Corina is an entrepreneurial woman who dreams of getting her family ahead in life.  Lately, she has had more customers and this makes her feel very satisfied.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because she offers them good customer service and the latest clothes at good prices.

Corina would like to grow her business and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more clothes such as skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, etc.  This will enable her to meet her customers' needs and bring financial security to her household so that she can proviD. her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, dresses, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Jerendi's Group

texts.en:
Jerendi K. is the leader of this group. She is 48 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Her first son works in construction in Bishkek, the second works in Kazakhstan, the daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Jerendi bought two calves for breeding. Currently, to meet her needs, she sells 5-6 liters (10 soms per liter) of milk every day. In this way she earns about 3000 soms per month. With the loan, she wants to purchase five farm animals for breeding. In the future Jerendi wishes to expand her business to be able to financially support her children. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five farm animals

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Садуллоева Ибодат проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, имеет двоих детей. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии она работает 15 лет. Кроме того Ибодат занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает канцелярские товары. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. В продвижении бизнеса ей помогает ее сын. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. То есть для покупки книжек, карандашей, ручек, тетрадей (общих и простых), фломастеров, альбомов, маркеров и ватманов.
texts.en: Ibodat S. lives in Vahdat. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She has a higher education in pedagogy.  She has been working in her trade for fifteen years. Additionally, Ibodat works in trade. She has a shop where she sells office supplies. She has been doing this work for seven years. Her son is helping her advance her business. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she offers. She is going to purchase books, pencils, pens, thick and thin composition books, felt-tip pens, albums, markers and flipcharts.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza B. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and is married to a taxi driver. They have raised three sons and a daughter. All the children are married and live separately with their families. The first son is engaged in retail trade in Bishkek and the other children are working in Russia. In 2006, with the initial investment of 30000 soms, Roza started to breed farm animals. She also sells 9-10 liters of milk every day. In this way she earns 5000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase seven more animals for breeding. In the near future, Roza wants to purchase home appliances to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Khomida

texts.en:
A. Khomida is a hardworking woman who is married. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She is engaged in dried fruit trading and also in animal husbandry. Khomida has been running her business thanks to Imon International which supported her in improving her dried fruit sales. She successfully repaid her first loan. She plans to use the second one to purchase an apricot garden in Kanibadam.

From her profits she purchased milk cows. She has a barn where she keeps her four cattle. Her daughter-in-law helps her in her business. Her sons are currently working in Russia and, with the money they have been sending her, she purchased a house. This loan will help her to improve her business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an apricot garden

loans.name: Khalilov

texts.ru: Халилов Шариф проживает в районе Яван. Ему 27 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. У него среднее образование. Уже три года как он занимается растениеводством. При доме он имеется не большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет злаковые культуры. Целью кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений для посева.
texts.en: S. Khalilov lives in Yavan. He is 27 years old, married, and has three children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in agriculture for three years. In front of his house he has a small plot of land where he grows vegetables and sows grain. He is taking out a loan to buy seed and mineral fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
Rahimjon is a hardworking husband and the father of four children. He works in a small restaurant which serves all sorts of food. He likes his work and stands out in it due to his attention to detail, the cleanliness of his establishment, the quality of his work and his friendliness. Since 1974 he has been running this business and has a lot of experience. He started his business cooking the national dish of sambusa (meat in dough). Today he rents a place at the market of “Sakhovat” in the central park. He wants to cooperate with Imon International as he would like to extend around his house to be able to cook there and attract more clients. For this purpose, he has requested a loan. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To extend around his house to expand his business

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Анакулова Зулфия жительница Вахдатского района. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает женскую и мужскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для покупки женского и мужского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Zulfiya A. lives in Vahdat. She is 29 years old and married. She has a secondary education. She works trading in the market. Primarily she sells women’s and men's wear. She has been doing this work for two years.  She is taking out a loan to buy women’s and men's underwear.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men's underwear

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie, 26 years of age, is still single. He operates a typical village store. He sells a variety of food products. He has been in this business for almost four years.

Freddie is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell in their village. He earns PHP 9,000 a month for these activities. He also plans to renovate and expand his retail store to generate more income. He hopes that Kiva and ASKI will continuously support his business for the better future of their family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Малаева Мухаббат проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Её муж и старший сын находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама Мухаббат занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет рис для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян риса.
texts.en: Muhabbat M. lives in Shahrituz. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband and oldest son are in the Russian Federation. Muhabbat is a farmer. She rents a plot of land where she grows vegetables and rice for sale. She has been doing this for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and rice seed.

loans.use: Для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян риса

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has been practicing both poultry and livestock keeping for five years and earns an income of Kenya Shillings 20,000 per month. He is married to Brenda. They still do not have children.

He learnt about KADET LTD through a friend and is applying for his third loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy broiler chicks to rear and to produce eggs, which he will sell.

He will plough the income generated back into poultry business. He hopes to own a very big poultry farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy broiler chicks to rear and to produce eggs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged 37, is a divorced father with one child. He is responsible for his child's upkeep. He owns rental houses and has been in that business for 11 years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase concrete, cement and sand for construction.


He expects to build two more units from the profits anticipated in his business and hopes to have more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase concrete, cement and sand

loans.name: Naftalus

texts.en:
Naftalus, aged 42, is married with two children. He runs a carpentry business and has been in this business for 15 years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he has managed to successfully pay the previous loan well.


He will use the profits from his business to educate his children. He hopes to open a classic workshop.

loans.use: To purchase tools and timber

loans.name: Boronboy

texts.ru: Нозимов Боронбой житель района Шахритус. Ему 39 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование у него среднее. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи и арбуз для продажи. В этой области более 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза.
texts.en: Boronboy N. lives in Shahrituz. He is 39 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education.  He is a farmer. Primarily, he grows vegetables and watermelons for sale. He has been doing this for more than eight years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.use: to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.name: Honyllette

texts.en:
Honyllette is 24 years old and married with one child. Her husband works as a farmer. They are living harmoniously in Gappal Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. 

To assist her husband earn their living, Honyllette operates a general store where she offers different products. She has been in this business for five years already and usually earns 5,000 PHP per month. To further develop her business, Honyllette is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables. In the future, she would like to continue taking loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Saba Saba Group

texts.en:
Abdllah M., who is in his early 50s, is married with five children. Some of the children are still in school. He has been selling second clothes and second hand shoes since 1982.  He works from 8:30am to 6:30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Abdllah's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start selling second hand shoes and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes. His dream is to one day have a big place where he can sell his products.

Abdlla will share this loan with his loan group "Saba saba", which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Abdllah is in the middle of the last row in a black shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock of second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary is a 26-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to University level. He is a driver and has been in the transport sector for eight years. With the earnings, he has been able to provide basics for his family. He has the challenge of consistent mechanical breakdown of his vehicle and his desire is to diversify and build rentals. Hillary needs the loan to purchase land.

loans.use: To purchase land.

loans.name: Angines

texts.en:
Angines M. K. has been operating a retail shop for about four years and earns KES 10,000 per month. She is married to Kioko and they still do not have any children yet.
	
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of KES 5,000 to buy soft drinks (sodas), sugar and flour for resale and restocking her retail shop.  
		
In the future, she plans to grow her business and own a wholesale shop. She is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (sodas), sugar and flour for resale

loans.name: Hondohondo Group

texts.en:
Theresia D. who is in her early 50s is a widow with four grown children. She has been running a business selling fruits, vegetable and powdered soap since 2005. She works from 6:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Theresia's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling soap and to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to start selling cosmetics and skin tights for ladies.  Her dream is to one day open a ladies clothes shop.

Theresia will share this loan with her loan group "Hondohondo", which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Theresia is the first one on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To start selling cosmetics and tights for ladies.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy, 55 years old, is married to a farmer. With four children, Remy decided to engage in a hog-raising business to earn income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase feed for her hogs. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly in her businesses. She uses her profits to pay for the tuition fees of their children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Нуров Абдулкосим проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где выращивает дыню и арбуз. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Целью кредита является закуп топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза для посева.
texts.en: N. Abdulkosim lives in Shahrituz. He is 43 years old, married, and has one child. He is a farmer. He rents a plot of land where he grows melons and watermelons. He has been doing this for twelve years.  He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.use: Закуп топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза для посева

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Vandan

texts.en: Mr. Vandan is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Vandan is a monk and he serves in the local Buddhist temple. He has been serving as a monk since 1998. His duties include attending everyday prayer at the temple, executing rituals at funerals, weddings and so on. His two children attend a local secondary school. Last year, Vandan did an external face-lift on his old house and now he is planning to do some renovation to the interior of the house. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy plaster, gypsum boards, paint and wallpaper to do interior decoration to his family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to redecorate the interior of his house.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda sells fruits and vegetables. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month in her business. The majority of her earnings are being spent for the needs of her four children. As a widow, Esmeralda is really working hard for she solely supports her children.

To sustain and improve her vending business, Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to give financial assistance to the needy like her.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Philisiwe Group

texts.en:
Thenjiwe is 50 years old and married with two children who are 14 and 27 years old. Her husband works for Capacity Factory Company and she cares for four relatives. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for three years and she sells frozen chicken packs and cold drinks at her home. She also receives income from a child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers who pay on credit and fail to pay on time. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy frozen chickens in packs. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her stock and not have to depend on her husband. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow. 

She thanks WDB for lending her money all this time and helping her with her business. She hopes that Kiva will do the same.

loans.use: To buy frozen chickens and cold drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional cloth and plates

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 34-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her husband is a driver. They have two children and their desire is to educate them so that they can become self-sustaining and build a house. She has been operating a salon for four years. She started with 2,000,000 UGX and she now has 4,000,000 UGX as working capital. She has the challenge of delayed payments by some customers and her desire is to own a beauty parlor. Joyce needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and other cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: To buy synthetic hair and other cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans à un agent de sécurité privé, Mme K. est mère de 02 enfants. Elle achète des ustensiles de cuisine au grand marché de Lomé et revend de manière ambulante à  la population depuis 2009.elle va partout où le besoins se fait ressentir. Ce premier crédit lui permettra de louer un local  si possible vu  l’importance des demandes et augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Ms. Kakon, aged 31, is [married] to a private security guard and is the mother of two children. She buys kitchen utensils at the Grand Market of Lomé and has been selling them door-to-door to people since 2009. She goes wherever there is a need. This initial loan will enable her to rent a spot, if possible, given the significance of the demand, and to increase her inventory of goods.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Divaajur

texts.en: Mr. Divaajur is 42 years old and single. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the Capital city of Mongolia with his younger sister's family. In 2002, he moved to the capital city from Zavkhan province, which is situated in the far west of the country. He was in search of a better life. In 2002, he bought a minivan and started running a transportation business. He carries people in the suburbs of the city where buses are insufficient. A few years ago, he divorced his wife and currently supports his two kids by sending some money to them every month. The transportation licensing authority sets strict health and safety requirements on vehicles carrying people. Therefore, Mr. Divaajur services and repairs his minivan on a quarterly basis. This time, the loan he is requesting will be used to buy some spare parts and to service his minivan.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts and service his minivan

loans.name: Tweweyo Women's Group

texts.en: 49-year-old N. Sarah has been operating her general merchandise retail shop for the past 15 years in Buvuma Island, Lugazi. The happily married mother of seven says she began this business with savings from her agro sales business. Through the course of those years in business, she says, it's been diligence, determination and prayers that have kept her business afloat. Sarah also ekes out additional profits from a fish selling business. Weekly, she says, her profits are approximately 100,000 shillings. With this loan, she says, she is going to purchase more retail general merchandise commodities to resell. In the group photo, one lady client was not around when the photo was taken, so I marked her as unpictured. The male client marked as unpictured actually appears in the photo but he did not look directly into the camera.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Perlicana

texts.en: Perlicana, 36 years old, is married to a farmer. They have three children. She has operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to use in the expansion of her store and to purchase additional food products and beverages to sell. Perlicana is grateful for having Kiva lenders and ASKI MFI who support her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products and beverages to sell

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado G. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Conrado is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Conrado owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Conrado has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Conrado joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conrado is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase a new motorcycle for transport services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conrado from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
A single lady of 60, Pricilla has been running a retail shop in Matuu for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, Pricilla is now requesting her second loan in order to buy more cooking fat, sugar, bread, blue band margarine and wheat flour. She will invest the extra profits back into the business in order to expand it.

Pricilla desires to grow her business and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more cooking fat, sugar, bread, blueband magarine and wheat flour.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena manages a tailoring business where she usually earns a net income of 4,000 PHP a month. She spends her income mainly for the education of her four children. Her husband assists her in supporting their daily needs through farming.

Wanting to make her business more productive, Filomena opted for a loan from ASKI and KIVA lenders of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase cloth, needles and threads. In the future, Filomena dreams of having her Ready-to wear (RTW) shop in the market.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, needles and threads

loans.name: Benrugous

texts.en:
Benrogous M. M. has been selling second-hand shoes for the last 22 years in Kibera, Nairobi. He is married to Irene and they have three school-going children. He earns an income of KES 20,000 per month from his shoe-selling business.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a group member who is a registered client of KADET, and he is applying for a loan of KES. 40,000, which he plans to use to buy more stock of children's and men's shoes for resale.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business and give a better education to his children and also to ensure that his family lives comfortably.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. M. has been selling home products to her customers in Kwa Njenga for three years and earns an income of KES 11,900 per month. She is married to Charles and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, with which she plans to buy more home products like basins, jugs, glasses, racks and buckets for resale.

She plans to invest the generated income by opening a salon in the future. Ruth is a determined and very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more home products such as basins, jugs, glasses, racks and buckets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Agarjav

texts.en:
Mr. Agarjav B. is 34 years old and a former dancer. He lives with his younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Until 2010, he was working as a professional dancer in a military dance ensemble. In 2010 he quit the ensemble due to an injury and started running a dance class for children. He works together with his former teacher. 

At the moment, his group has around 40 children aged 6 to 14. 

Agarjav’s younger sister is unemployed at the moment. Therefore, he wants to run a grocery retail kiosk at the food market to involve his sister.  

The loan Agarjav is taking will be used to install big mirrors in his dance classroom and part will be used to buy the necessary products to resell in his kiosk.

loans.use: To install big mirrors in his dance classroom and to buy necessary products to resell in his kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of food for his hotel.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 32 years, is married to Edwin and they are blessed with three children. 

She sells clothes while her husband manages the car hire and commercial vehicles business they co-own and which has been in operation for four years. The business earns them a monthly income of KES.44700.

This is her third loan with KADET, and she has successfully managed to repay her previous loans.
She plans to use the loan funds to install four new tyres, five seat belts and repaint the small car and for the buses she wants to install 52 seat belts, repair the 50 seat covers, buy six tyres and a steering wheel.

Mary hopes to use the anticipated profits to stock her clothes business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To service the commercial vehicles by installing new tyres, seat belts, repainting the cars and buying a new steering wheel

loans.name: Hannah Wataku

texts.en:
Hannah Wataku W., 32 years old, has a one child, 14 years old, whom she single-handedly supports. 

She does livestock farming and sells milk for additional income as a secondary business. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She has applied for a loan that she will use to buy a cow to increase milk production. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a plot where she will be able to expand her farming business. 

Hannah hopes to improve her living standards and become a prominent business lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing materials for resale and cattle which she will resell later on.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn O. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old and single. 

To make a living, Arlyn provides Internet services in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a printer to improve his Internet services. 

This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to improve his Internet services.

loans.name: Villa's Group

texts.en:
Villa is married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They are blessed with three children. They are harmoniously living at San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. Villa manages a massage parlor where she earns 4,000 PHP a month. Villa's group members are determined to pursue their businesses to improve their living standard. 

Villa is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase needed materials and to open up her new massage parlor in their town. Her profits will be spent in food, shelter, and medicines. She hopes that Kiva and ASKI MFI will continue to support her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase materials to open a new massage parlor

loans.name: Millicent Wambui

texts.en:
Millicent, 29, is married and has two children who are 9 and 4. Her spouse does business to produce additional income while she runs a boutique. She has been in this business for two years and has been getting good returns.

This is her second loan with KADET; she successfully repaid her first. She will use the money to restock her boutique with more clothes. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to open another outlet. 

She in future hopes to operate a large scale fashion shop and import clothes  herself.

loans.use: to buy stock for her boutique

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon Maina N., 29, is married to Grace Muthoni, who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his shop selling clothes for a period of six years with an income of about 14,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is his second loan after successfully repaying the previous one from KADET Ltd. He wants to use the loan funds to buy more clothes for resale. 

He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to replenish stocks of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Stephen Kiarie

texts.en:
Stephen Kiarie, 32, is married to Jane Wanjiku who also contributes to the family income. He has one child who is three years old. He has been in the business of selling construction items for a period of about six years with an income of about 15,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is his third loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy more cement for the business. He hopes to own a bigger hardware store, venture into agriculture, and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Шерматов Ибодулло проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его дети работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама он имеет средне - специальное образование, шафер. В этой области работает 12 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян риса, минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Ibodullo S. lives in Shahrituz. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His children work on a small farm. He has a vocational education as a driver.  He has been working as a driver for twelve years.  He also farms. He primarily grows vegetables and grains for sale. He has been farming for more than ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, mineral fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 49, is married to Salome and has three children. He runs a retail shop and has been in this business for 15 years with a good income. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. which she plans to use to add more items to the shop such as sugar, soft drinks, soaps and wheat flour. 

He hopes to grow his business and in the future to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase items like flour and sugar for his store

loans.name: Saingerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Saingerel is 31 years old and lives with her two-year-old daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

In November 2010 her husband Munkhdalai 37, went to Korea to work on a labor contract. He is working at a factory there. Saingerel says that they were very lucky, because not everyone who applies is chosen to work abroad on a labor contract. Saingerel said that her husband sends a money back home on a monthly basis. 

A lot of Mongolians, especially youngsters, leave the country to earn some money abroad. Last year Saingerel started the building project and she managed to put a basement in the house. Now she wants to continue her project and complete the building of a family house. Therefore she is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, plaster board, and insulation materials, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for the labor to improve her house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel M. est commercant des aliments, et client d’ACB depuis 2011.  Il a 38 ans, il est marié, et il a 4 enfants entre 2 mois et 11 ans, et 2 personnes en charge.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Emmanuel est né à Rubavu, au Rwanda, et il a fini 4 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de jus, Colgates, mayonnaises, pommes de terre, huile, sucre, et autres choses a détailler pour son business de commerce.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les quantités à vendre dans son business.  Il voudrait devenir un grossiste dans le secteur de Rubavu, assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et éduquer ses enfants.  Pour augmenter son revenu, Emmanuel fait aussi la location de maisons a usage résidentiel (70,000FRW par mois), et la location d’un frigo (15,000FRW par mois).
texts.en:
Emmanuel M. owns a grocery store. He has been a client with the microfinance institution ACB since 2011. He is 38 years old, married and the father of four children, aged between 2 months and 11 years, and he takes care of two other people. Two of his children attend school. Emmanuel was born in Rubavu in Rwanda and he studied until fourth grade in secondary school.

This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy juice, toothpaste, mayonnaise, potatoes, oil, sugar and other retail grocery items. He does not expect any problem to meet the repayment schedule of the loan. His growth strategy for the business is to increase his inventory. He would like to become of wholesaler of groceries in Rubavu, ensure the well-being of his family and have his children educated. To increase his earnings, Emmanuel rents houses for dwelling (70,000 Rwandan francs per month) and a refrigerator (15,000 Rwandan francs).

loans.use: to buy juice, toothpaste, mayonnaise, potatoes, oil, sugar and other grocery items.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Jeune homme marié de 37 ans,kodjo  est papa de deux enfants.sa femme et lui sont revendeur.il vend des boissons et des produits alimentaires dans un kiosque à lomé.il a ouvert sa petite boutique  depuis 1990 et s’approvisionne sur place et à Accra(pays voisin).il est à son deuxième prêt.ce dernier lui permettra de stocker les marchandises qu’il vend pour les besoins des consommateurs.
texts.en: Kodjo, a young man of 37 years, is married and the dad of two children. He and his wife own a vending stall in Lomé where they sell drinks and groceries. He opened his small store in 1990 and gets his supplies on location and from Accra in neighboring Ghana. This is his second loan. It will help him to stock up his inventory and meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean H. est soudeur, et célibataire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles et clous pour la construction de sa maison d’habitation.  Il n’y a pas de difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une maison a louer pour augmenter son revenu.  Apres qu’il construit sa propre maison, il va se marier.  Son ambition pour sa vie est de créer une famille.
texts.en: Jean H. is a welder. HE is single. He will use his loan to purchase metal sheets and nails to build a house to live in. He doesn’t expect any problems repaying his loan. His business strategy is to build a house to rent out in order to increase his revenues. After he has his own house built, he is going to get married. His goal is to start a family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and nails for building a house

loans.name: Izafa

texts.ru:
Izafa S. zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmete so svoim mujem i detmi. Izafa rodilas v 1971 qodu. 
Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Izafa S. is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and children.  Izafa was born in 1971.  She has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for five years. Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to expand her business and the production of milk for sale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badegna est composé de veuves et de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, du charbon de bois, de savons et d’articles divers.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Badegna sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
MAH D. compte acheter de l’arachide avec les producteurs du  village et effectue sa vente  sur place dans village de Koba, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is composed of widows and married women. They average 50 years of age, with five children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Koba, Diolia Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell peanuts, charcoal, soap, and miscellaneous items. 
The members of the Badegna group are on their third solidarity loan.

Mah D. plans to purchase peanuts from village farmers. She sells locally in the Koba village, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 15,000 West African Francs, which will be used to pay off the loans, cover the costs of her participation in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her peanut business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Donath

texts.fr: Donath K. est jardinier, cultivateur, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 67 ans, il est marié, et il a 6 enfants entre 13 ans et 23 ans, et 3 personnes en charge.  Cinq de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il va utiliser son prêt pour construire sa maison d’habitation.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir un crédit pour la construction de sa propre maison.  Il est heureux de construire cette maison pour sa famille, parce que son ambition pour la vie est d’avoir un bon foyer.
texts.en: Donath K. is a farmer and has been a client of ACB since 2007. He is 67 years old and married, and he has six children between the ages of 13 and 23 and cares for three people. Five of his children go to school. He was born in Rwanda, and he will use his loan to build his residence. There should be no difficulties repaying the loan. His goal is to have a loan for the construction of his own home. He is happy to build this house for his family, because his life's ambition is to have a good home.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Bring Amber Court Members To Unite Group A

texts.en:
N. Grace is 29 years old. For 5 years now, she has been overseeing operations at her flourishing beauty salon which she began with modest savings from her poultry sales business. The beauty salon caters mostly to the interests of the middle-income women around Amber Court Street in Jinja. Grace says her weekly business operating profits are to the tune of 90,000 UGX. 

Grace is happily married, but with no kids yet. She says the modest strides she has made are all due to her diligence and determination. With this loan, Grace says she is going to purchase more hair chemicals to use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase more hair chemicals to use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnanbourouthila, préfecture de Dioïla,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des bois et du charbon.                                                                          
La cliente NANA F. compte acheter du bois de chauffe avec les bûcherons  du village. Elle effectue ses ventes au niveau de la ville de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de bois..
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married with an average age of 48 and three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the Gnanbourouthila village, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood proximity, and friendship. They do business selling firewood and charcoal.

The Benkadi group women are on their third group loan which will be used to buy firewood and charcoal.

Group member NANA F. plans to buy firewood from the village woodcutters. She sells for cash and credit in the city of Fana, and her customers are both men and women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA which will be used to repay the loan and to pay social ceremony fees. The rest will be reinvested in her firewood sales business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Joshua Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Augustina describes herself as a neat and hard-working woman. She is a 39-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Augustina is currently the group leader of Joshua Trust Bank. For the past 3 years, Augustina has been a small trader who sells food items like cassava, plantains, cocoyam and bananas. She also engages farming as her second business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest into purchasing assorted food items to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market. Augustina hopes to mobilize more savings to buy a piece of land to start building a house to accommodate her family.

The other members of Augustina’s group are traders and service providers. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: to purchase food items

loans.name: Pashalina

texts.en:
Pashalina is a 57-year-old lady, married to Patrick, and they do not have children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for 2 years, earning an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Pashalina learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is already registered with KADET LTD. This is her first loan, which she intends to use buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be able to distribute clothes wholesale. Pashalina describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement composé de veuves et de femmes mariées, ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tissus, de miroir, du tiéké et de la poudre de henné.        
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
DALLA D., qui est la présidente du groupe, espère  s’approvisionner en tissus avec les grossistes au grand marché de Bamako et du Burkina Faso. Elle vend ses habillements à domicile, au marché de Barouéli et  dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser au cours du cycle un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les frais de contributions des différentes cérémonies civiles, certaines dépenses familiales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group comprising widows and married women who are, on average, 37 years old with 2 children and live in traditional extended households in the city of Barouéli in the Barouéli prefecture in the Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and friend connections. They sell fabric, mirroirs, tiéké (a Malian food dish), and henna powder.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity (group) loan.
Dalla D., the president of the group, hopes to supply herself with fabric from the wholesalers at the grand markets in Bamako and Burkina Faso. She sells clothing at her house, at the Barouéli market, and at the surrounding markets, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.
She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA throughout the loan cycle, and will use this profit to reimburse the loan and pay for various social ceremonies and family expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward K. is a 41-year-old farmer from the village of Jocho, West Georgia. He is married and has a five-year-old daughter Mariam. 

Edward and his wife Mzia have a one-hectare plot of agricultural land. They grow a variety of vegetables and fruits on this plot. Harvested products are sold locally to the retailers of fruits and vegetables. Also, the family owns a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Mzia and Edward produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, they have three beehives with bee colonies. A small amount of gathered honey is sold. 

With the requested loan, K. will purchase an additional seven beehives and will be able to gather more honey and sell it in season. Part of the increase in profit will be reinvested in bee-keeping business development and the other part will be spent on renovation of the house to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase seven beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been running a food restaurant in Ngalaiya Tala town for 11 years. She is 35 years old and married to Charles. They do not yet have children.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. This is her third loan, which she plans to use to buy cereals for cooking, flour and vegetables.

Her desire is to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cereals, flour, and vegetables

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
