Zaur yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Zaur B. 36 let. 
Zaur seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec dlya prodaji. On takje delayet iz shersti ovec tepliye zimniye jeleti i prodayot ix.
texts.en: Zaur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who know lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has a child.  Zaur B. is 36 years old. Zaur now needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep to expand his flock for resale.  He has been a shepherd for seven years and breeds sheep for resale.  He also makes warm winter vests from wool and sells them.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 29 years old. He lives in Adjara, in the village of Kveda Tsinsvla. Koba and his wife Mziuri run an agricultural farm in the village. They have a one-hectare plot of agricultural land where various fruits and vegetables are grown. After the harvest season, the fruits and vegetables are sold to the retailers. Along with the above-mentioned business, Koba is a craftsman of gas counters. When he has orders from the villagers, he repairs gas counters and gets additional income. 

With the requested loan, Koba and Mziuri will purchase a milk cow. They plan to produce Georgian cheese and sell it on the market. It will increase the income of the family. In the future, the couple plans to renovate their house, as it is already old and needs some remodeling.  They hope that the cheese production will allow them to save for the renovation.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de charbon de bois, d’arachide et de haricot.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, du charbon, de l’arachide et du haricot.                                                                          
NAH D. compte acheter de la friperie avec les commerçants de la ville de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Koba, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women in the Kelegna group are all married, average 48 years of age and have three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Koba, in the "prefecture" of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in clothes, charcoal, peanuts and beans.

The women in the Kelegna group are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used to buy clothes, charcoal, peanuts and beans.

Nah Dembah is planning to buy second-hand clothing from traders in the town of Dioïla. She carries out her sales on a daily basis in the village of Koba, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 9,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and to make contributions to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her clothes trading activity.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Hanifahon's Group

texts.en:
Hanifahon B. is the leader of this group. She is 60 and married to a farmer. Her son, 35, works as a surgeon. He has a wife and two children: a son and a daughter. The wife works in the Department of Registration and the children are preschool age (under seven). 

Hanifahon, together with her husband, is engaged in farming. The family owns 1.2 hectares of land; half of the territory they use for cultivating cotton and the other part is used to grow vegetables. Hanifahon believes that this year she will get a good harvest and gain a high profit. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase mineral fertilizers for the fields. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Saniya, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 48 ans, 8 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnanbourouthila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Saniya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter exclusivement du charbon de bois.                                                                          
La cliente FANTA D. compte acheter du charbon de bois avec les charbonniers du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes au niveau de la ville de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de charbon.
texts.en:
The women of the group Saniya are all married, and they average 48 years of age and eight children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Gnanbourouthila, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in charcoal. These group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy charcoal exclusively. 

Ms. FANTA D., a client, intends to buy charcoal from the charcoal providers in and around the village. She makes her sales in the village of Dioïla and accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help with societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 37 years old. She lives in the village of Urekhi in the western part of the country. Zeinab is married. Her husband Omar works for a construction company. They have two sons who are 7 and 12 years old and go to the local school. 

Zeinab is leading the agricultural business of the family. She grows vegetable and fruits on the family-owned 0.6-hectare plot of land. Harvested fruits and vegetables are sold to the retailers and bring approximately 300 Laris per month to the family.  Also, they have 12 chickens and selling eggs is an additional source of income. 

With the requested loan, Zeinab will purchase a milk cow, feed for the cow and fertilizers for the plot. She will start cheese production and will sell it in the village. It will positively impact the income of the family, which is 1,000 Laris per month now. Zeinab expects that after fertilizing the plot, she will receive more and better quality harvest and it will also increase her income. 

Zeinab’s family hopes that after the income increases, they will be able to save for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow, feed for the cow and fertilizers

loans.name: Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutra, composé de veuve et de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 51 ans, 7 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnanbourouthila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Soutra sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments et du charbon.                                                                          
BAHMALICK T. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeuses de la ville de Dioïla, pour ensuite vendre sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The group Soutra is composed of widows and married women. They average 51 years of age and seven children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Gnanbourouthila, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments and charcoal. The group members are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used to buy condiments and charcoal.

Ms. BAHMALICK T. intends to use her loan to buy condiments from retailers in the city of Dioïla. Accepting cash or credit, she will sell the goods locally in the village to a customer base composed of women and men.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help cover the costs of societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
To make a living, Araba A. has been selling kenkey and rubber bowls at Amoanda, a fishing community in Cape Coast. (Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish.)  

Araba has two children. She wants to increase her earnings and plans to do so by increasing the production and sale of kenkey. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and corn husk to produce kenkey to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and corn husk to produce kenkey for sale

loans.name: Gulerahon's Group

texts.en: Gulerahon K., aged 27, is the leader of this group. In order to earn money to meet their family's needs her husband has gone to work in Russia. Gulerahon takes care of two sons, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). With the initial investment of 8,000 soms Gulerahon started cultivating wheat. She has applied for this loan so she can use the money to purchase fertilizers for growing wheat. In the near future she plans to start repairing the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing wheat

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, sont toutes des femmes mariées et ont en moyennes 44 ans, 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier  SOCOURA-NORD, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des parures, des condiments et des gâteaux.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. La cliente ROKIA K. compte acheter des bijoux (boucles d’oreilles, colliers) avec les revendeurs de la ville de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place dans la ville au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et quelque fois des hommes aussi.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de bijoux.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are all married, and on average are 44 years old with 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioïla, Socoura-Nord neighborhood, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women met each other through connections with family, neighbors and friends.

The women sell jewelry, condiments and cakes. They are on their sixth group loan. Group member Rokia K. plans to buy jewelry (earrings, necklaces) from the sellers in the town of Dioïla. She sells her goods every day in the local town for cash and on credit, to customers who are mostly women but sometimes men too. Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay the loan installments, pay for contributions to social ceremonies and the rest will be reinvested in her jewelry business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. is a seamstress at Amoanda near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and together they live with her five dependents.

Agnes wishes to grow her business and so needs a loan from Kiva to buy materials, such as lining and other items, which will enable her to meet the  demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as linking, for her sewing business

loans.name: Konstantin

texts.en:
Konstantin N. is a 43-year-old farmer. He comes from the village of Shroma, West Georgia. Konstantin is married and lives with his wife Melano, his parents and three daughters. His elder daughters Irina and Mariam are 14 and 13 years old and go to the local school. Little Linda is two years old and is at home with mom and dad. 

All adult members of the family are involved in the family agricultural activities. They have two milk cows. The dairy products from the cows are sold on the local market. In addition, they grow nuts, potatoes and tangerines and sell them locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Konstantin requested a loan for tilling the land and purchasing fertilizers. It will improve the harvest and thus the income of the family. In the future, Konstantin plans to reinvest the profit in development of the dairy farm by purchasing more milk cows and selling more dairy products.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and fertilizers

loans.name: Ariunselenge

texts.en:
is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. All her children, aged 10, 13, and 16, attend local secondary school. Her husband, Tserendorlig, is a taxi driver who manages his own taxi service business. In addition, her husband works as a welder during summer seasons.

Ariunselenge manages a Mongolian traditional clothing (Del) making business in her town. She started her business in 2008. Now she makes variety of colorful, stylish and modern Del that fulfill her customers' individual requests. Besides her manufacturing operation, she also sells collections of sheets and cotton. 

Ariunselenge is a polite woman who is trying hard to feed her family. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a workshop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a workshop

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 56 years old and lives in the village of Kobuleti, a seaside resort in the western part of the country. Revaz is married and lives with his wife Tina, sister and four adult children: two daughters and two sons. 

Revaz is an electrician who works in his profession in the village. In addition, he contributes to the profitable functioning of family dairy farm. They have three milk cows. They sell the dairy products from the cows on the local market. Also, the family grows nuts, maize and tangerines and sells them on the local market.  The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris. Family members want to expand the dairy farm by purchasing more cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow them to keep more livestock. 

With the requested loan, Revaz will purchase construction materials and expand the cattle shed. In the near future, the family will purchase more cows and sell more dairy products. With the increased income, the family will afford themselves better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand the cattle shed

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is single. She is a hairdresser and a seller of cooking utensils at Amoanda near Elmina.

Ama uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. A loan will serve as an additional capital to purchase varieties of cooking utensils to supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to establish a salon.

In this picture Ama is displaying the cooking utensils she sells.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of cooking utensils to supply her customers.

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en:
Dugersuren is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His older son goes to a local secondary school, while the younger one is in kindergarten. His wife works at a university in her town.

Dugersuren manages a animal hides trading business with the help of his older brother. He started his business in 2001. They collect sheep and goat skins from herders and sell them at a local market. This type of business is quite profitable in local areas of Mongolia.

He is an open-minded man who says, "I want to build a shop with my loan." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to build a shop near to his home.

loans.use: to build a shop near to his home

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. for some time now has been making doughnuts for sale in Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She moves from one area to another to sell. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to enable her to make more doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to enable her to make more doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is a 50-year-old small businessman from Lanchkhuti District, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maguli and 25-year-old daughter. 

Vakhtang owns a vulcanization service workshop in the village. He has been involved in this business for five years. It brings the family on average 550 Laris per month. In addition, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They produce and sell dairy products from the milk of two cows. The family also has a plot of agricultural land where they grow maize and nuts. Harvested corn and nuts are sold on the local market. 

With the loan, Vakhtang plans to renovate the workshop and purchase new equipment. As a result of this investment, he will be able to provide better quality service to the customers and his workshop will become more competitive, attracting new customers. An increase in clients will bring positive changes to the family’s income. They will be able to purchase more household items and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate his workshop and purchase new equipment,

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery A. sells fante kenkey in Amoanda near Elmina. (Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish). Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to store to produce kenkey, as the price of maize keeps increasing. She hopes to reinvest her increased profits for further growth.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to store to produce kenkey, as the price of maize keeps increasing.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba W. A. sells kenkey, which is a Ghanaian staple made from corn, in Amoanda near Elmina. She is divorced and has two children. Her ex-husband assists her in taking care of their children even though they are divorced. She is eager to increase the quantity of kenkey produced as her customers are increasing. Her loan will be used to buy maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to expand her kenkey (a Ghanaian staple made from corn) business.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz T. comes from the village of Zeda Sazano, Imereti region. He is 46 years old and living with his wife, Shorena; his mother; two daughters (20 and 14 years old) and a 12-year-old son. His younger daughter and son go to school. The elder daughter helps her parents with agricultural activities. 

Ramaz’s family has two milk cows and ten sheep. Cheese from the cows and sheep is sold locally. Also, they sell lambs seasonally. In addition, Ramaz runs a mixed store in the village, where groceries and various household items are sold. 

With the requested loan, Ramaz will increase stock in trade for the store. It will increase the turnover in the store and positively impact the income of the family. In the near future, Ramaz and Shorena’s elder daughter will marry. Ramaz is saving to cover his daughter’s wedding costs. An increase in his profit will allow him to make more savings for the wedding.

loans.use: to increase stock in trade for a mixed store.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. is married and has seven dependents. She has no educational background but sells bags of charcoal to make her living in Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of her home. 

Ekua wants to expand her charcoal business and needs a loan so she can supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a shelter to protect the charcoal from rain.

loans.use: to expand her charcoal business so she can supply her customers.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. sells bags of charcoal in Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storehouse where she can keep the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: For some time now, Araba A. has been selling bags of charcoal in Amoanda near Elmina in Cape Coast. She wants to expand her charcoal business, and so she needs a loan from Kiva to acquire additional bags of charcoal, as the price keeps increasing. She hopes to plow any profits as a result of the loan into increased capital.

loans.use: to acquire additional bags of charcoal, as the price keeps increasing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more equipment for mobile-telephone sales.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells provisions in Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and educating the children and paying household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy Milo (beverage powder), milk, soaps and other provisions to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes to plow back any increased profits into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy Milo (beverage powder), milk, soaps and other provisions to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F. displays clothes and sandals in bowls, and carries them on her head into the smaller villages in Elmina for sale. She lives together with her husband and five children. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy sandals and clothes to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to buy sandals and clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. is divorced and has six dependents. Aba sells kenkey (a sourdough dumpling) and fish at Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.

As a single parent, taking care of her dependents has been a little challenging. She needs a loan to increase the quantity of kenkey she can produce so that she can meet the needs of her family.

Aba plans to reinvest the increased profits from the expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of kenkey produced so she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba S. is into the production and sale of kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina. (Kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves.) She is a divorcee taking care of six dependents. Even though she is separated from her husband, her husband contributes to the education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey she sells.

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu A. sells soaps and fish at Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of one child.  She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the fish business.

loans.use: to buy fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a fish monger at Amoanda near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has five dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa T. makes Fante kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina for sale. (Fante kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in banana or plantain leaves.) She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Adjoa has been selling kenkey for some time now. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize to expand her kenkey business. She anticipates using the new profits to educate her children. In the basket in front of her are some Fante kenkeys.

loans.use: to buy maize to expand her kenkey business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells cloth and material at Amoanda near Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She assists her husband in taking care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and material to supply her increasing number of customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and material to sell.

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.ru:
Ulviyya uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov dlya prodaji molochnix produktov. Ona delayet yogurt, kefir, tvorog i t.d iz moloka i prodayet v magazini.
 Ulviyya A. 34 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Ulviyya nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov.
texts.en: Ulviyya has been working as a dairy farmer for four years. She makes yogurt, farmer's cheese, and other products and sells them in stores. Ulviyya A. is 34 years old. She is married and has two children who go to school.  Ulviyya needs 2300 AZN to buy cows in order to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nyamaahuu

texts.en:
Nyamaahuu, 48, is married and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her older daughter has graduated from college and the younger two daughters are still students. One of her sons is a pupil and the younger one is in kindergarten. Nyamaahuu's husband, Namjildorj, is a driver who transports people from one place to another.

Nyamaahuu has operated a vegetable sales business in her town since 1990. In the spring, she plants a variety of vegetables, including cabbage, carrots and potatoes, and sells them in the fall. She is planning to continue and to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "All I want is to get my children educated and help them to be better persons." She is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase seeds and other needed equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other needed equipment.

loans.name: Francess

texts.en: This is 25 year-old Francess.  She is married and has a 4-year-old child. She has 1 additional dependent, a niece who lives with her.  In 2006, Francess established her ready-to-wear clothing business. She began her business as a means of getting income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, Francess earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy additional ladies' wear. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Francess plans to educate her child to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Bintia

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Bintia.  She is married and has 2 children, 14 and 5 years old. She has 1 additional dependent, her younger sister who lives with her.  In 2008, Bintia established her medical drugstore business, after completing her medical course and deciding, through that experience, to sell medicine. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from the business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy additional pharmaceutical drugs. In the future, Bintia plans to pursue a higher level of education and take good care of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy different types of  pharmaceutical drugs for her business.

loans.name: Djalal

texts.ru:
Etoto molodoy chelovek yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qorda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Djalal B. 23 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. 
Djalal uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svayo kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe. Semya Djalala ochen bednaya i poeotmu on mnoqo i userdno rabotayet chtobi pomoch obespecheniyu svoyey semyi.
texts.en: This young man is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who know lives in the Fuzuli region with his parents.   Djalal B. is 23 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Djalal has owned his own cafe for two years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs for his cafe.   Djalal's family is very poor, and therefore he works very hard and diligently so that he can help support them.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M. G. is a single woman who does not have any children yet. Her business is located in a market in the residential area of Makongeni in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Juliana has a salon called Julie's Salon and Cosmetics, where she has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women. She also sells cosmetics and jewellery. She says that this business is profitable. The only major challenge she has is power rationing in Thika, which slows her business and consequently lowers profits. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 80,000 to buy more hair weaves, relaxers, cosmetics and jewellery to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, Juliana hopes to grow the cosmetics shop and open others in Thika town. She describes herself as loyal and sociable.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair additions and jewellery.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIESSIRI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants dans des familles nucléaires à Massablacoura Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leurs entreprises, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles achètent avec les  prêts des condiments alimentaires, des habits, des chaussures et des ingrédients pour faire de la restauration tel Chitan D..
Avec ce prêt la dame Chitan D., compte 2 sacs de 50 kg de Riz, 1 bidons de 10 litres d’huile et biens d’autres articles pour une bonne restauration. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bougouni pour faire sa vente dans son restaurant à la gare routière de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’étranger d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI group are married women with an average age of 36 and four children. They live with their spouses and children in nuclear families in Massablacoura Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are acquainted through kinship, business activities, and neighborhood proximity. 

In order to satisfy their clientele and expand their businesses, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With their loans they are buying condiments, clothing, shoes, and ingredients for prepared food. 

For example, Chitan D. is using her loan to buy 2 50-kilo bags of rice, 1 10-liter container of oil, and many other products necessary for preparing food to sell. She gets her supplies at the Bougouni market and sells at her restaurant at the Bougouni bus station to both male and female customers, including tourists. With this loan she plans to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, some of which will be reinvested in her business. The rest will be used to pay her children's health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for prepared food

loans.name: Gombo

texts.en:
Gombo is 52 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His son goes to a local secondary school. With the help of his wife, Gombo manages a meat and dairy trading business. Generally, his wife is responsible for selling dairy products and Gombo is responsible for selling meat and meat products. He started his business in 2000 after having worked as a carpenter. Since that time, Gombo has managed to stabilize his business and has built a strong customer base. 

Gombo is quite an experienced businessman who knows the unique features of his business very well.  He is a hardworking and open-minded man who is planning to expand his business in the future. He says, “I want to save some money for my son’s education.” Gombo is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and dairy products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a widow with four children. She provides for the basic needs of her family by selling kenkey, a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish. Comfort sells kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina. 

Comfort is requesting a loan to buy bags of maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide an education for her children. Comfort knows that education is now the key to success.

loans.use: to buy maize and expand her kenkey business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice W. K. is 25 years old, single and has two children, 9 and 12 years old. Her business is located at the Thika main stage, where there are a lot of people passing by. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Alice runs a general store where she sells items such as flour, rice, sugar, beverages, cooking oil, detergents, etc. to the local people. She has been in this business for the last three months and says that it is profitable. The major challenge Alice faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more items to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cooking oil, flour, rice, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is married and has one child. She sells rubber bowls and also cooks food for sale at Amoanda near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband to pay school fees and other household expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards building a food joint. In this picture, she was traveling to some of the communities to sell the cooked food.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine M. N. is 40 years old and has two children, 4 and 14 years old. He and his wife hope to give their children good education to the university level. Justine's business is located in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Justine has been selling brake fluid, brake pads, clutches, corner lights and headlights to minibus, truck and car owners in Thika for two years and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenges he faces are financial constraints and lack of proper business management skills. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using this loan of KES 20,000 to buy brake fluid and brake pads to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a big auto spare parts store in Thika. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy brake fluid, brake pads, etc.

loans.name: Comfort Araba

texts.en: Comfort Araba D. cooks food to sell in the community of Amoanda near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is a widow who takes care of three children and is responsible for the well-being of her family and home. Her loan will serve as additional capital to buy food items to cook for sale.  She hopes to invest the new profit into her children’s education. At the time of this visit, she had finished selling the food made for the day.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame M. sells smoked fish in Elmina, a major fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in taking care of her home.

To increase her earnings, Maame needs a loan from Kiva to allow her to purchase larger quantities of fish and boost her sales. She intends to reinvest any extra earnings from the increased sales back into her business. Her long term goal is to ensure she has put aside enough to support her children through their university education. In the photo, Maame is shown standing next to a traditional fish-smoking oven

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to boost her sales.

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia C. est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni. 
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 3ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), Kadia décida d’apprendre comment mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle suivi sa mère pour apprendre  les activités d’achat et de vente de draps de lit, de pagnes, de chaussures et d’habits.  Avec une expérience de 8 ans; elle maitrise cette activité d’achat et de vente de pagnes, chaussures etc. 
Elle est à son 4ème prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso et elle envisage acheter, avec ce nouveau prêt, des habits et chaussures au Burkina Faso. Ses articles sont vendus à la maison et au grand marché marché de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en: Mrs Kadia C. is married, 31 years old and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and her children in the neighborhood of Hérémakono Centre in Bougouni. Kadia dropped out of school when she was in third grade of elementary school and decided to learn how to earn her living from an income generating activity. This is why she spent her time with her mother and learnt how to buy and sell bed sheets, pagnes (colorful West African cloths), shoes and clothes. Today she has 8 years of experience and fully masters her activity. This is her fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All her previous loans have been repaid on schedule. In her strive to expand her business, she joined Soro Yiriwaso. She intends to use her new loan to buy clothes and shoes in Burkina Faso. She will sell her articles at home and at the great market in Bougouni. Thanks to this loan, she expects to make a profit of 70,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Ansu.  He is single and has one child, age 6. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is his nephew.  In 2001, Ansu established his men's shoes and sport shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to create a source of income to support his family. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about $210 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Ansu requires a loan in order to buy additional men's shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Ansu plans to build a shop and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for his business.

loans.name: Sevjidmaa

texts.en: Sevjidmaa is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. All of her three children, age 12, 13, and 15, attend the local secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter who manages his own wooden product-making business near to his home. She conducts a vegetable trading business at a local market. She has been planting daily consumption vegetables for thirteen years and is planning to continue in the future. Now she owns 25 acres of land and harvests five to six tons of potatoes every year. She is a polite woman who says, "I am very thankful for receiving the loan."  She is requesting a 1,750,000 MNT loan to purchase a greenhouse and some seed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse and some seed.

loans.name: Kwame Mkuruma Group

texts.en:
Damian K., who is in his early thirties, is married with three children who are still going to school.  He is an electrician. He works from 8.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Damian's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to repair and renovate his office.  His dream is to one day start selling cosmetics.

Damian will share this loan with his loan group "Kwame Mkuruma", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Damian is 1st on the left in front, in a blue shirt.

loans.use: to repair and renovate his office.

loans.name: Diekabara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIEKABARA est composé de femmes mariées et de célibataire, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et résident dans le quartier Torakabougou à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de céréales  et avec  Awa B. pour le commerce des produits de beauté. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Awa B., compte acheter 2 cartons de parfum, 10 douzaines de mèches et des pommades. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako au niveau de fournisseurs pour les revendre  dans se kiosque sis au quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The Diekabara group is made up of married and single women, who average 34 years of age with two children each. They live in traditional families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives and friends.

With the aim of satisfying their customers and expanding their businesses, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they could carry out their trading activities selling condiments, cereals, and in the case of Awa B., beauty products. They are on their second group loan and the previous loan was repaid in full. 

With this new loan, Awa B. is planning to buy two cartons of perfume, ten dozen hair extensions and creams. She gets her stock from suppliers in Bamako in order to resell them on a retail basis in her kiosk located in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay the loan and the rest reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. O. is forty years old, married, and has three children between the ages of eleven and one. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

He sells brake fluid, brake pads, clutches, corner lights and headlights to matatu (minibus) and car owners in Thika. He has been doing this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

George is using this loan of 20,000 KES to buy side mirrors, bumpers, etc. to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In future, he sees himself owning a big auto parts shop. He dreams of financial comfort in his future. He describes himself as hardworking and responsible.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors, bumpers, etc.

loans.name: Alpha T

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old E..  He is married and has three children, ages 10, 6 and 3 years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives from the village.  In 2009, E. established his food and drinks business. He began his business after graduating as a caterer. He became convinced to open a canteen where he sells food and drinks. This business has become the main source of income for the family. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about $373 every month from this business. 

E. would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He needs the loan in order to buy star beer, stout and soft drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, he plans to get outlets in the other communities and educate his children well.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks for his business.

loans.name: Farakognouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FARAKOGNOUMA est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Torakabougou l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et élargir la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de chaussures, des draps de lits et des glacières à l’image de  Sadio SANAGRE.
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe dont le précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Sadio SANAGRE compte acheter 5 douzaines de glacières auprès de ces fournisseurs de Bamako capitale de la république du Mali pour les revendre  en détail et en gros , au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et le reste sera  utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The group FARAKOGNOUMA is composed of married women who average 35 years of age and four children each living in conjugal nuclear families with their children and husband. These women reside in Torakabougou, a district in the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and community.

Concerned about satisfying their customers and expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do commerce in shoes, bed sheets, and insulated containers, as does Ms. Sadio SANAGRE. They are on their second group loan. The previous one has been properly repaid. 

With this new loan, Sadio plans on buy 5 dozen insulated containers from suppliers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and then sell them retail and wholesale for cash or on credit. Her customer base is composed generally of women.

With this loan, she plans on making a monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be reinvested in the enterprise, and the rest will be used for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás es casado, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Conavi de la ciudad de Pilar, donde tiene una casa propia, donde cuenta con las condiciones básicas para desarrollar tarea de venta de pescados.
El desarrolla esta actividad hace aproximadamente cuatro años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el llevar adelante su trabajo, ya sea canoa y mallones, además, se moviliza con una motocicleta propia. 
Nicolás es muy reconocido en Pilar por la gran variedad de pescados que tiene, es por ello que espera contar con este apoyo para poder seguir mejorando la calidad que ofrece a sus clientes, y solicita el crédito para poder comprar materia prima como caña, hilo de pescar, cebo, entre otras y continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Nicolás is married.  He’s 44 years old and lives in the Conavi neighborhood in the city of Pilar where he owns his house that has all basic conditions required for fish sales.

He’s been in this line of work for about four years.  He has the necessary infrastructure to continue with the work, that is, a canoe and nets.  He also owns a motorcycle to get around on.

Nicolás is very well known in Pilar because of the great variety of fish he has. Because of this he hopes to have this support to continue improving the quality he offers his customers and is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like a fishing pole, fishing line and bait, among others, to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies: fishing pole, fishing line, bait, etc.

loans.name: Kalo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KALO sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles achètent avec les  prêts des tissus, Céréales et des Condiments alimentaires
Avec ce nouveau prêt Odile D. compte acheter 2 sacs de 25 kg de sel avec les grossistes du grand marché de BOUGOUNI, 1 sac de piment, et  2 paniers de tomate avec les jardiniers de la place pour en suite revendre au petit marché de Torakabougou (l’un des quartier de ville de Bougouni) en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé.
texts.en: The members of the group Kalo are married women who are on average 35 years old, have 5 children and live with their spouses and children in nuclear families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met one another through commercial and neighborhood relationships.  With the intention of satisfying their customer base and growing the size of their business, they have decided to join the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  With these loans, they will buy cloths, cereals and spices.  With this new loan, Odile D. expects to purchase two 25 kg bags of salt from the wholesalers at the big market in Bougouni, one bag of pepper, and two baskets of tomatoes from the same place to later resell them at the small market of Torakabougou (one of the neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni) at retail, for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of women.  With this loan, they expect to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, of which a part will be reinvested in the company and the rest used to pay for healthcare costs.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Bwangu Development Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Joweria N., a happily married mother of two, has been overseeing her beauty salon business for the past decade in Nakifuma-Mukono, earning shillings 150,000 each week. Having previously operated a charcoal-sales business, she began this business through the persuasion of close friends.

With this loan, Joweria will purchase more cosmetics for use in her beauty salon. As a qualified teacher, she teaches in many schools in and around Nakifuma and places great value on hard work, an ethic she practices diligently in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna Diakité est une femme mariée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfant et son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, dès à son jeune âge, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus.
Pendant des années elle a tenté plusieurs activités, sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida d’apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente des ignames auprès de mère.
Avec une expérience de 7 ans, elle maîtrise son activité. Elle s’approvisionne en igname à Gueya. 
Dans le cadre du renforcement des activités, elle décida de prendre un autre prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 sacs d’ignames.
Elle mène cette activité au grand marché de Bougouni mais aussi à la maison. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna Diakité is 36, married, and has 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in Torakabougou, a district of Bougouni.
As she quit school when she was still young, she decided to undertake incoming generating activities.
For years, she tried out various activities, but was unsuccessful. This is how she decided to learn the business of buying and selling yams with her mother.
With 7 years of experience, she now masters the trade. She buys her yams in Gueya.
In order to strengthen her business, she decided to get a loan from Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 bags of yams.
She works in the big market of Bougouni but also at home.
With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 50 000 FCFA. With this benefit, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Mirembe Nyenje Womens Group

texts.en:
Jane N. is 45 years old and has been in the fishing business for almost 10 years. She works from Nyenje in Mukono. Jane is a happily married mother of five children who says she was inspired by one of her close friends to try her hand at this business. Before that, she ran a small retail business. 

Jane makes a weekly profit of 100,00 UGX. She will use her loan to purchase better fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Alice Josephine

texts.en:
This is Alice. She is 63 years old and married with six adult children ages 40, 39, 37, 35, 32 and 29. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives.  Alice established a palm oil business in 1991. She started her business at a time when things were very difficult and her husband was not able to provide food for the family. “I started a business to save my husband and family from stress,” said Alice. She works six days a week, ten hours a day, to earn 1,800,000 SLL every month. 

Alice is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. Alice thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is Mohamed. He is married with three children ages ten, twelve and 28. He has two additional dependents that live with him because they are orphans and he is assisting them. Mohamed owns a general store that he started to become self-reliant. He works seven days a week, twelve hours a day and earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month.

Mohamed is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy additional milk, sugar, margarine, and batteries to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to get a commercial bike. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, margarine and batteries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pots, skillets and saucepans

loans.name: Valens

texts.fr: Valens R. est sentinaire, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 52 ans, il est marié, et il a 8 enfants entre 4 ans et 25 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Valens est né au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son quatrième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une vache pour sa famille.  Il n’y a pas des difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solder le crédit et demander un autre pour acheter une autre vache, pour vendre de lait.  Il voudrait avoir une ferme, éduquer ses enfants, et mettre sa famille en bon état.
texts.en: Valens R. is a guard and has been a client of ACB since 2010.  He is 52 years old, married, and has 8 children between the ages of 4 and 25.  Three of his children go to school.  Valens was born in Rwanda and has a primary school education.  This loan is his fourth from ACB, and he has a good history of repayment.  He will use his loan to purchase a cow for his family.  No difficulties from non-repayment of the loan are expected.  His growth strategy for his business is to settle the balance of the loan and to request another, in order to buy another cow to sell it's milk.  He would like to have a farm, educate his children and put his family in a good state.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Elda Alejandra

texts.es:
Elda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, ellos se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y ajonjolí.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para las plagas, estos insumos son muy necesarios para iniciar la siembra, aunque también son necesarios en todo el proceso.
Su objetivo es ayudara a sus padres, generar ingresos que cubran sus necesidades y también la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elda lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with her parents and two siblings.  They are corn and sesame farmers.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.  These supplies are very necessary in order to begin planting although they are also needed throughout the process.

Her objective is to help her parents generate income that will cover their needs as well as the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias H. owns Medical Dimensions, a business that provides life-saving medical training to the Greater El Paso area. As a licensed CPR instructor with over 12 years of experience teaching, Elias is capitalizing on his experience and extensive contacts in the medical community by opening Medical Dimensions. Elias’s clients are businesses and institutions in all fields that require basic medical training for their employees. Until he gets his business up and running full force, Elias has continued his full-time job as an advanced medical training instructor. In addition to teaching CPR, Elias is developing a curriculum that teaches health care professionals how to communicate with Spanish-speaking patients. With Spanish so widely spoken in El Paso, some medical institutions are requiring their employees to attain basic proficiency in “Medical Spanish.” Elias’s course will teach medical terminology and basic phrases in Spanish that will facilitate better patient care. Elias officially opened Medical Dimensions on April 21st of this year. His first classes are scheduled to begin in June, when he will be teaching his Medical Spanish courses at two regional hospitals. With this loan, Elias bought a computer and printer for his business, as well as supplies for his classes. He is currently finishing his course preparations as well as procuring items such as face masks and valves that will be used by his students during training. Elias loves teaching CPR because he knows that it can be the difference between life and death. He lives by the motto coined by Albert Einstein that goes, “Try not to be a person of success, but rather try to become a person of value and success will follow, because people are to be valued not for how big or small they are, but rather for their ability to perform the tasks for which they were made.”

loans.use: to purchase a computer, printer, and supplies for his cardiopulmonary resuscitation training classes.

loans.name: Manfredy Ernesto

texts.es:
Manfredy, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo y un hijo de 9 años de edad, él se dedica desde pequeño a la agricultura, se creció ayudando a su padre en estas actividades, sembrando maíz y chile, también atiende las labores de la ganadería. 
Actualmente necesita comprar 1,500 plantas de chile, también tratamiento para plagas, esta compra le permitirá tener una nueva producción, con los cuidados necesarios.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para ganar ingresos que ayuden a su familia.
texts.en:
Manfredy lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department.  He’s a farmer.  He has his own house where he lives with his wife and a 9-year-old son.  He’s been farming since he was a little boy.  He grew up helping his father in these chores, planting corn and chilies, and also doing chores related to raising livestock.

He currently needs to buy 1500 chili plants as well as insecticide that will make new production possible, given proper care.  His goal is to work hard to earn income that will help his family.

loans.use: to buy 1500 chili plants and insecticide.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valeria; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar y también se dedica al negocio de venta de chanchos y lo vende en la feria de Inquilpata que queda ubicado en el distrito de Anta, la socia se dedica al negocio de bar desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 12:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bar y negocio de venta de chanchos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cerveza y para comprar alimentos para los chanchos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Valeria, 20, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with running a bar; she also sells pigs at the Inquilpata Market located in Anta.  She runs the bar from 10am until 12pm.  She supports her children with this business.  She wants to enlarge the bar business and the pig sales business.  She is asking for a loan to buy beer and pig feed.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy beer and pig feed.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Janeth; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados y también se dedica a la venta de productos secos como cebada,papa,trigo,cebada y maíz, ella vende en el mercado de Anta y los ganados en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, su esposo también trabaja en el negocio de transporte haciendo servicio urbano hacia el distrito de Huarocondo y por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados y venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados y para comprar productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janeth, 29, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with livestock sales and also sells dry goods like barley, potatoes, wheat and corn.  She sells in the Anta market and the livestock is sold at various markets in Anta district.  Her husband works in transportation providing urban transport in Huarocondo District.  She supports her children through these businesses.

She wants to enlarge the livestock sales business and the dry goods sales business.  She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and to buy dry goods at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and to buy dry goods at wholesale.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario, es agricultor, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa, tienen casa propia, y Mario labora como agricultor desde muy pequeño, tiene una gran experiencia, pues su padre lo llevaba todos los días para que aprendiera.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de plantas de chile y tratamiento para plagas, ya que el produce chiles y quiere invertir en 2,000 platas.
Espera tener una buena cosecha para comercializarla, y tener mayores oportunidades de mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Mario is a farmer.  He lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department with his two children and his wife; they have a house of their own.  Mario has worked as a farmer since he was very little; he has a lot of experience because his father took him along every day so that he’d learn.

He’s asking for a loan to buy chili plants and insecticide because he’s a chili farmer and he wants to buy 2000 plants.   He hopes to have a good harvest to sell and have better opportunities for economic improvement.

loans.use: to buy chili plants and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, paint and windows for house construction

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Carlos, el socio tiene 28 años de edad;  el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 1 hijo de  1 y medio años de edad; el socio trabaja en una imprenta, el socio es empleado en esta imprenta y está encargado de muchas labores dentro de ella, el socio desea ahora el crédito para poder comprar víveres para el hogar, el socio quiere comprar sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar para su familia el cual pagara de una sola y con lo que le den de su sueldo el ira pagando en partes, para lo cual el socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar al por mayor los víveres que le servirán en su hogar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de víveres para el hogar.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO” and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

Carlos, 28 is the member.  He has a spouse and a one-and-a-half-year-old son.  He works in a print shop.  He’s employed by the print shop and he's in charge of several jobs in it.

He needs a loan to buy groceries for home.  He wants to buy sacks of rice, oil and sugar for his family all at once.  He will use his salary to repay the loan in installments.  He needs the loan in order to buy the foodstuffs for his home at wholesale.  He asks for a loan to buy groceries for his home.

He is grateful and wants to express that he will repay his loan installments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. 
Este comité es de Thompson San Lorenzo, en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que varias de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen.
La Señora Monica B. se dedica por ejemplo a la preparación y venta de empanadas, muy popular en el país, además de la venta de bebidas heladas, con lo cual mantiene a su familia y se esfuerza por trabajar dignamente 
enfrentando la crisis económica. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, compra de arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, etc.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora committee was born two years ago through the management and support of another committee which was working in the same place.

This committee is from Thompson, San Lorenzo.  During more than two years of very hard work, this group has grown both socially and financially.  The committee's members are known in their area as very hard-working women.  They experienced a very difficult situation during their last loan cycle in that several of their members failed to make their weekly repayments.  The group repaid their loan and made a pledge to successfully re-start their committee.

Monica B. prepares and sells empanadas which are very popular in her country.  She also sells iced drinks.  Through her work, she supports her family and strives to work honorably, facing up to the financial crisis.  She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, flour, etc.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil and flour; to buy ladies' and men's clothes and underwear; to buy oranges, bananas, tomatoes, lettuce, peppers and onions; to buy jewelry and supplies for making food; to buy creams and nail polish

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de tres años, él se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de chile, por el momento se está preparando para adquirir un buen número de plantas.
Solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de la compra de chiles, también abono y tratamiento para las plagas, esta compra le ayudara para que pueda tener una nueva producción.
Su aspiración es tener todo lo necesario para poder vivir dignamente y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
David lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his wife and three-year-old son.  He’s a farmer, specifically chilies.  He is currently preparing to acquire a good number of plants.

He is asking for a loan to cover the purchase of the chilies and also manure and insecticide.  This purchase will help him have a new production.

His wish is to have everything necessary to live decently and meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy chili plants, manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que queda ubicado en el mercado de Anta y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz y luego lo vende  en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar la tierra de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideos y comprar fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 50, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank located in Anta District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.  

She has a spouse and alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store located in the Anta market.   She also has a field where she grows potatoes and corn to later sell in the various markets in Anta District.  She supports her children through these businesses.

She wants to enlarge the grocery sales business and improve her farmland.  She is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, oil and noodles and also to buy fertilizer for her field.

She is happy with the loan and committed to repay.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, oil and noodles and to buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Oscar Emilio

texts.es: Oscar, casado su esposa trabaja como pedagogía siendo un ingreso económico más, sus hijos estudiantes, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, ofreciéndole comodidad, siendo de mayor necesidad en estos momentos, trabajo como conductor desde hace un tiempo, honestó, trabajador.
