La creciente demanda que la bodega D. Socorro ha venido experimentando, la ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Socorro es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Socorro is a 49 year-old mother who is married and has one child.  Her husband works in construction.  They live in their own home, in a rural area of Cata-Caos district.  They do not have basic services.

Socorro sells groceries from a small grocery store in her home.  She sells staples and essential household products to her neighbors and local customers.  Her business is very popular.  Socorro has been in this business for three years and has three years experience in the field.  Through her business activity, she helps her husband to financially support their family.

The growing demand that Socorro's store has been experiencing recently has maD. her think of expanding it by acquiring more products.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Socorro is a hard-working, very good-natured woman.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to expand her business, buying more merchandise

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto de profesión fontanero con más de veintisiete años laborando para la misma empresa, el cual ha logrado estabilidad laborar como económica para el bienestar común de la familia.
Hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo económico de su señora esposa ya que es comerciante y ambos apoyan a sus tres hijos, todos estudiantes.
Logro mejoras a su vivienda con financiamiento en Afodenic en donde lleva tres ciclos lo cual ha cambiado techo, y otros cambios. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo reparara paredes interna de la vivienda para una mejor construcción de infraestructura. Comprando: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Humberto is a plumber by profession and has worked for over 27 years in the same company.  This economic stability has provided quality of life for his family.

He also receives economic support from his wife who is a merchant and both support their three children who are students.  With loans from Afodenic he has been able to make home improvements.  During those three loan terms he was able to change the roof and carry out other modifications.  With the new loan he plans to repair the inside walls of the house to improve its infrastructure.  He will buy blocks, sand, cement, and iron to begin construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the inside walls of his house.

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años  de edad y es madre soltera de una niña de  ocho años de edad que estudia en la escuela. Vive con su hija y una hermana.
 
Tiene un pequeño  salón de belleza en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, maquillajes, manicura de uñas entre otros muchos servicios. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 09h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan de sus servicios y a  ella no se le hace problemas ya que es su trabajo y tiene que atenderles bien a sus clientes. Tiene su salón de belleza hace 8 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, shampoo, oxigena, y otros materiales útiles es el arreglo personal. Hace siete años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápidos y los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus metas son tener un SPA y una casa propia ya que arrienda donde vive.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Mujeres En Acción" meets every two weeks.

Here we meet Mrs. Rosa, age 51, who is single and has an eight-year-old daughter who is in school.  She lives with her daughter and a sister.

Rosa has a small beauty salon where she offers many services such as hair cuts and color, make-up, manicure and many others.  She works Monday through Saturday, from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later if customers require her services.  This causes no problems for her since customer service is very important to her.  She has been in business for eight years and it is going well.

This loan will be used to buy hair color, shampoo, oxidant and other personal care materials.  She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years and enjoys the low-interest rates and rapid issuance of the loans.

Her goals are to have a SPA and her own home, since she currently lives in rental property.

loans.use: To buy hair color, shampoo, oxidant and other personal care materials.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 25 años, es una mujer casada, Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la vena de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que le gusta su actividad y conversa con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, colonias, bolsos, calzado y ropa interior. El deseo de Rosa Argentina es terminar de construir su casa que por proporcionarla a sus hijos lo necesario no ha podido comprar los materiales.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina, age 25, is married and has three children in her care.  She sells general merchandise for a living and has been doing so for seven years.  She is a hard worker who enjoys what she does and talking to her customers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing, colognes, handbags, shoes and underwear.  Rosa Argentina's dream is to finish building her house.  She has been unable to buy the required materials until now because her children's needs have always come first.

loans.use: To buy clothing, colognes, handbags, shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lourdes. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora Lourdes,  indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de las vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de quesos, que compra de la ciudad de Viacha, desde hace tres años atrás aprendiendo este negocio de su mamá, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio haciendo ventas ambulantemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para invertir en su negocio (compra de quesos) los que venderá en las tiendas los días domingos por las tardes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEMBRADORAS" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.   The bank is comprised of 11 members whose board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Lourdes.  The members' business activities vary and include: commerce, production and service.

Mrs. Lourdes says she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago through an invitation from neighbors.  She is in the cheese business and buys her products in the city of Viacha.  For three years now she has been learning the trade from her mother.  She says they began the business by providing a door-to-door service.

The loan involved now is to buy cheese that will be sold in the store on Sunday afternoons.  This provides an income to help support the family.  She has a common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training regarding health and credit.

loans.use: To invest in her cheese business.

loans.name: Olidais Esther

texts.es: Olidais R. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la venta de productos variados en miscelanea y mediante guías especializadas vende productos cosméticos ropa interior en líneas de crédito adaptadas a las características de sus clientes;  ella vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 8 a 14 años en el barrio la Paz de la ciudad de Barranquilla., donde está ubicado su negocio. Olidais empezó inicialmente vendiendo dulce en la puerta de la casa de su madre, quien vive en la calle central del barrio e inició con $60.000 COP que le regaló su hermano.  En su microempresa, maneja un margen de utilidad no menor de 30% y unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 30 días.  Su credikiva es el primero que realiza con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo; con él comprará diversas mercancías especialmente ropa interior que tiene encargada y está segura que rotará inmediatamente, lo que le augura una inversión exitosa.  Su sueño más adelante es tener un almacén en un local propio aunque su mayor desafío es  la incomodidad del espacio de su apartamento y el poco espacio que dispone para su vida familiar un poco mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Olidais R. lives in the city of Barranquilla and sells different products for a living.  Through specialized catalogues she sells cosmetics and underwear on a credit basis adapted to each customer's characteristics.  She lives with her husand and children, ages 8 to 14, in the neighborhood of La Paz in Barranquilla where her business is set up.  Olidais began selling sweets out of the front of her mother's home in the center of the neighborhood.  She began her business with 60,000 COP that her brother gave her as a gift. 

Her microbusiness has a profit margin of no less than 30% and an accounts receivable turnover of 30 days.  This is her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she plans to use it to increase her working capital and buy different merchandise, especially underwear which has already been ordered.  She is sure this will be a sound investment with an immediate turnover. 

Her dream for the future is to have her own store.  For now her main challenge is the limited space in her apartment.

loans.use: To buy different merchandise to fill orders.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y cerdos. Hace más de 19 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable por lo que siente muy orgullosa de tener un medio de vida. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues tiene que recorrer distancias bien largas a otras comarcas. Durante algunos años esta emprendedora estuvo sin tener un trabajo que le genera ingresos, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado tener su propio negocio. Ella sueña con realizar algunas comodidades  que le permitan realizar su labor cotidiana.
texts.en: Tomasa del Carmen sells general merchandise and pigs. She has had this business for more than 19 years. She is a very responsible person who is proud of earning her living this way. This loan is to buy pigs, because she has to travel long distances to other areas. For some years, this enterprising woman had no job generating income, but after time, she was able to open her own business. She dreams of having some comveniences that will make doing her daily work easier.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Futuro Para Un Bienestar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar está formado por 11 socias y un socio quienes son personas responsables y ambles que luchan en sus trabajos  para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y en busca de un mejor futuro. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y una deliciosa gastronomía. Ciudad que en 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora María Carmita S. vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo   estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María se dedica a la lavar ropa ajena, esta actividad  la realiza hace un año y también realiza limpiezas de casas.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con este negocio.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Por esta ocasión nos acompañan en la foto unos niños que son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Futuro Para un Bienestar [Future for Wellbeing] community bank is made up of 11 women and one man who are responsible and friendly people who fight in their jobs to improve their household finances and seek a better future. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city has a lot of tourist attractions to visit and a delicious cuisine. 

María Carmita S. lives in the area of San Pedro del Cebollar in the city of  Cuenca. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. Her oldest son goes to a neighborhood school. Her husband is a construction worker. They don't own their own home, and they rent.  
 
María takes in laundry. She has been doing this activity for a year and she also cleans houses.
 
Maria is on her fourth loan in the community bank. She was invited to join by her sister. She will invest the money from the loan in buying chickens to start a business. 

Her dream is to have her own house.

On this occasion, children of the members accompany us in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, tiene un hijo a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia con su familia,  ellos residen en una  zona rural  de Chacupe bajo en el distrito de  La Victoria,  contando  con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica.

Rosa trabaja en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era más joven. Como actividad principal Rosa cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Rosa los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella  desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and has one child in her care.  She lives in her own home, together with her family.  They live in a rural area of Chacupe Bajo, in La Victoria district.  They have access to well water and electricity.

Rosa has been working in agriculture since she was young.  Her main business activity is raising animals, especially sheep.  Her animals are located in some pens near her home.  Rosa feeds them grains and natural pasture.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who frequently visit her area.

Rosa would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed to expand her business and make more income.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

Rosa is a committed and hard-working woman.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia tiene 50 años, es separada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, actualmente sus hijos la ayudan en esta actividad, dando de alimentar a sus animales y cuidar de su salud. Las ventas de estos animales lo hacen en temporada de ferias que se presentan en su ciudad. Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura donde cultiva papa, maíz y habas que vende después de cada cosecha y esto dura alrededor de 6 meses, por lo que tiene que esperar vendiendo animales para así no dejar de generar ganancias. Considera además que las variaciones climáticas afectan seriamente su cosecha por lo que se concentrará en estos próximos meses en aumentar su capital de trabajo en animales vacuno y ovino. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, considera que pertenecer a su banco comunal es una valiosa experiencia que le sirve para mejorar su economía en el aspecto de saber distribuir adecuadamente sus ingresos y esta muy agradecida por esto por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales como cerdos.
texts.en: Dionicia is 50 years old, separated, and she lives with her 3 children in a house which she owns. She has been a cattle farmer and agriculturist for more than 18 years. Her children help her in these activities, feeding the livestock and taking care of their health. She sells her livestock during the season when the fairs come to town. She is also involved in agriculture, cultivating potatoes, corn, and fava beans. She sells the products after every harvest, lasting about 6 months. So while she waits to sell her livestock she is still able to earn an income. She also considers the climate variations that seriously affect the harvest which is why she will concentrate the following months on increasing her working capital, in the form of cattle and sheep. This is her 14th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she believes that being part of her communal bank is a valuable experience. It helps her with her finances especially in knowing how to adequately distribute her income. She is very thankful and she is committed to be on time with her payments. With the loan that she requests she will invest in the purchase of more livestock, including pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su conviviente y su menor hijo, residentes en la ciudad de Ferreñafe. Juan vive en una parte  rural de este distrito,  aún así tiene los servicios básicos de agua y luz.


Juan se dedica ala comercialización  de verduras y tubérculos en el interior del mercado de Ferreñafe.  Esta actividad la iniciando como ambulante y ahora cuenta con un establecimiento en el mercado desde hace más de 10 años,  lo que le ha permitido tener clientela fija y con mucha experiencia en el rubro. 

 Juan desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para poder mejorar sus servicios higiénicos dentro de su vivienda, lo que le  permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Juan,  es un cliente nuevo para edpyme alternativa, se cuenta con muy buenas referencias de su trabajo y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old.  He lives in his own home, together with his partner and one dependent child.  They live in the town of Ferreñafe.  Juan lives in a rural part of this district but has basic services of water and electricity.

Juan sells vegetables and tubers in Ferreñafe market.  He started out in this business as an itinerant vendor but he has had an establishment in the market for 10 years now.  This has allowed him to gain a regular customer base and a lot of experience in his field.

Juan would like to acquire a loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can improve the bathroom facilities in his home.  This would allow him to enjoy a better quality of life.

Juan is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has very good work references and is responsible.

loans.use: to improve his home's bathroom facilities

loans.name: Duglas Uriel

texts.es:
Duglas, de 29 años de edad, es originario de una pequeña comunidad llamada Palo Verde ubicada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, el se dedica a sembrar hortalizas. El empezó a trabajar desde temprana edad, se fue  Costa Rica a trabajar para buscar una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, ahí el logro ahorrar para comprar un terreno que es donde hoy en día tiene sus siembras y estableció su hogar, el posee ½ manzana de siembra de tomate , el comercializa sus hortalizas en su misma comunidad pero le gustaría venderlo hacia los mercados centrales de Estelí para  obtener un buen precio. 
El solicito el préstamo para la compra de insumos, abono, pago de mano de obra, fertilizante para sembrar hortalizas. Espera poder obtener un buen rendimiento en su cosecha, darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos. El tiene como meta poder comprar mas terrenos para siembra y comprar un vehículo para transportar sus productos fuera de Estelí.
texts.en: Duglas is 29 years old and he is originally from a small community called Palo Verde, located in Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Esteli. He cultivates produce. He started in the business at a very early age. He went to Costa Rica to look for a better work opportunity. He managed to purchase some land there and that is where he has his plantations today and where he established his home. He has 1/2 a field of tomatoes and he sells his products in his own community but he would like to sell in the central markets in Esteli to obtain a good price. He requests a loan to purchase ingredients, fertilizers and to hire help. He hopes to have a good yield in the harvest and to provide better maintenance to the cultivations. His goal is to purchase more farm land and to purchase a vehicle to transport his products outside of Esteli.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products, fertilizers, and to hire farm hands.

loans.name: Delvis Joel

texts.es:
Delvis tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su madre. Su casa está  ubicada en el sector de Licapa,  una zona rural del distrito de Paijan en el departamento de La Libertad   , 

Delvis se dedica a ofrecer servicios de transporte público, en una mototaxi (moto con una cabina para transportar personas). Delvis tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a esta labor donde ha ganado experiencia en el rubro y tiempo en el cual  ha adquirido clientela fija.

Delvis esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que  pueda darle mantenimiento al motor de su mototaxi haci como también el cambio de carpa y algunas piezas 

Delvis cuenta con muy buenas referencias  por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos , lo consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Delvis is 19 years old and lives with his mother.  Their home is located in Licapa sector, a rural area of Paijan district, in La Libertad department.

Delvis offers a public transport service in a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin for transporting passengers).  Delvis has been in this business for more than two years.  He has gained experience and, over time, he has also acquired regular customers.

Delvis is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can have the engine of his motorcycle taxi serviced.  He also needs to replace the canopy and some other pieces.

Delvis has very good references from his neighbors and acquaintances who consider him to be a hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to have his engine serviced and to renew the canopy on his motorcycle taxi as well as some other parts

loans.name: José Higinio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Higinio le esta haciendo falta el techo del patio al frente de su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, madera, varilla y pagarle a la persona que contratara para realizar la mejora, desea que sea lo concreto ya que es más segura y duradera. 
Planea pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carretea. Que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que su esposa la señora Blanca Estela se encarga del cuidado de los hijos y de la casa.
texts.en: The house belonging to Jose Higinio does not have a roof over the front patio but he doesn't have the funds that he needs to carry out this improvement. He requests a loan to purchase material, such as cement, wood, steel rods, and to hire a contractor for the project. He wants it to be made of concrete because it is safer and longer lasting. He plans on paying the loan with a part of the salary he earns from his work as a transport truck driver. This is the source of income for his family. His wife, Blanca Estela, takes care of the children and the house.

loans.use: to build a roof over the front patio.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
Jose tiene 50 años de edad es , no tiene hijos menores de edad.  vive con su esposa en una zona rural
 donde realizan sus actividades
 
José se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era más joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside.  El se dedica aesta labor desde hace  10  años aproximadamente


Jose desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles los cuales se utilizará para la comprar mas animales  y fertilizantes para su cultivo para que posteriormente tengan mejores ingresos

José es una persona empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 50, lives with his wife in a rural zone where they carry out their activities; they have no minor children.

José has been working in activities associated with agriculture since he was younger.  On the one hand he raises small farm animals, especially sheep, in some corrals located near his house; he feeds them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the zone where he lives. He’s been in this line of work for about 10 years.

José wants to get a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and fertilizer so that income will be better later on.

José is a determined, hard working person.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señorita. Nelly es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta Parroquia es de clima frió, sus bellos paisajes reflejan la belleza natural del sector y desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy trabajadora, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita Nelly tiene 21 años y es madre soltera de un niño 3 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en donde ayuda económicamente, su mamá labora realizando los quehaceres domésticos del hogar y su papá es agricultor, la casa en la que habitan es de propiedad de sus padres. 

La Señorita. Nelly labora en un centro infantil, se dedica a esta actividad por que le gustan los niños. Labora hace 7 meses y trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para iniciar con este negocio.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miss Nelly is a member of the communal bank "San Jose". She lives in the community of San Pedro, belonging to the Santa Ana sector. This is known to be a cold climate sector and it is known for the beautiful scenery of natural beauty and from the downtown of the sector a large part of the city of Cuenca can be admired. The population is very hard working and they maintain their culture and their traditions. 

Nelly is 21 years old and she is the single mother of a 3-year old boy. She lives with her parents and she contributes financially. Her mother provides cleaning services and her father is an agriculturist. The house where she lives belongs to her parents. 

Nelly works in a children's day care. She is in the business because she loves children. She has been working there for 7 months, working from Monday to Friday from 8am to 4pm. 

It is the second loan she accesses through her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of pigs to start a business.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Erlita

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 36 años de edad tiene con un hijo a cargo.  Vive en casa de sus familiares, en una zona rural de Pacasmayo

Carmen hace mas de 10 años se ha logrado establecer en un mercado de abastos de la localidad donde vive  en un puesto de venta de verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad . Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia,. El negocio de Carmen  siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 



Carmen está solicitando un préstamo a edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que puedan comprar  más mercadería y posteriormente venderla en en su establecimiento.

 Carmen  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le concern le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and has a dependent child.  She lives in her family's home in the rural area of Pacasmayo.   

Ten years ago Carmen established a vegetable stand in the food market where she lives.  She buys her merchandise at the wholesale market in the city and every day she has a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers to offer her customers.  This business is an important source of income for her family.  Carmen's customers prefer her business because of her friendly service.    

Carmen is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] so that she can buy more merchandise for her business.

Carmen is a very hard-working woman of good character.  Those who know her have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mariano Rosario

texts.es:
El Señor. Mariano es socio del banco comunal San José, vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana,  esta Parroquia es de clima frió, sus bellos paisajes reflejan la belleza natural del sector y desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy trabajadora, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

El Señor Mariano tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que  está estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposa labora como empleada, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Don Mariano  labora en el área de la construcción y gracias a su experiencia ahora es maestro constructor. Ha laborado en esta área desde los 15 años de edad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitado por su suegra. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de materiales de construcción para realizar algunos acabados que le hacen falta a su casa.

Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr. Mariano is a member of the communal bank "San Jose". He lives in the Santa Ana sector. This is known to be a cold climate sector and it is known for the beautiful scenery of natural beauty and from the downtown of the sector a large part of the city of Cuenca can be admired. The population is very hard working and they maintain their culture and their traditions. 

Mariano is 31 years old and he is married common-law. He has a 10-year old son and he attends primary school in his community. His wife is employed and with their combined work they have built a house of their own. 

Mariano works in the construction field and thanks to his experience he is now a master builder. He has been working in this field since he was 15 years old. 

He is on his second loan through is communal bank. He was initially invited to join by his mother-in-law. The funds from his loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to carry out some necessary home improvements.

His goal is to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Santiago Emiliano

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor  hijo a su cargo. Ellos residen  en un caserío llamado  lnueva esperanza  en el distrito de Olmos, ados horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Santiago se dedica  al transporte público con ruta olmos y anexos ;desde hace  5 años  en olmos.  En los diversos anexos de dicha zona y además obtiene otros ingresos como venta de combustible en dicha zona.  Tambien cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Santiago esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme a Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales le dará mantenimiento a su mototaxi ( moto con una cavina para trasnportar persona) de esta manera podrá  genera mas ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad.


 Santiago  es un cliente nuevo para edpyme alternativa , del cual se tiene muy buenas referencias, de su trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
Santiago is 42 years old and lives with his wife and dependent child.  They live in a small village called Inueva Esperanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Santiago provides a public transport service between Olmos and its outlying villages.  He has been providing this service for five years.  He also makes additional income from selling fuel in this area.  He has regular customers in the area.

Santiago is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle taxi is a motorcycle with a cabin for transporting passengers).  In this way, he will be able to make more income and improve his quality of life.

Santiago is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has very good work references.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Fiorella Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fiorella tiene 25 años de edad, ella es conviviente.  Vive en casa propia con su esposo, la casa está ubicada en una zona rural llamado Caserío Pedregal Alto  Distrito de  Tambogrande del departamento de Piura, donde no cuentan con los servicios básicos. 

Fiorella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros los cuales los vende recorriendo caseríos cercanos donde tiene clientela conocida y cobra semanalmente, Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 1 año. Su esposo agricultor, aportando de esta manera en la canasta familiar.

Fiorella esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que ella pueda comprar mas mercadería (prendas de vestir),pueda innovarlo con ropa de temporada y por consiguiente pueda incrementar sus ventas y seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Fiorella es conocida en su comunidad por su entusiasmo y empeño de salir adelante día día, ella es una madre muy entregada a su familia y es por eso que se esfuerza por darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 25 years old and lives together with her common-law husband, in their own home, which is located in a rural area called Pedregal Alto, in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  They do not have basic services.

Fiorella sells men's and women's clothes.  She sells her products in nearby villages where she has established customers and collects payment every week.  She has been in this business for more than one year and, through her work, she helps cover her family's basic expenses.

Fiorella is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more merchandise, refreshing her business with seasonal clothing.  This will enable her to increase her sales, continue growing in her business and improve her quality of life.

Fiorella is known in her community for her enthusiasm and commitment in getting ahead day by day.  She is a mother who is very committed to her family and, for this reason, she works hard to provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so that she can refresh her business with seasonal clothing

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery  vive en el  barrio Bellavista del municipio D. Malambo y allí tiene un negocio D. fotografía donD. también ofrece servicios D. diseño gráfico. Durante dos años estudió en Bellas Artes la serigrafía  y trabajó durante dos años más en un almacén, luego en otra empresa y finalmente cuando deciD. ser independiente, aplicó el con el dinero D. su liquidación a la compra D. su dos primeras cámaras D. segunda mano  y con ella inició con su mercado más cercano: el D. su familia, amigos y  gradualmente ha logrado ampliar  su área D. acción hacia los municipios D. Soledad y hacia la ciudad D. Barranquilla.  DesD. hace tres años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por  recomendación D. su hermano,   cliente D. esta organización desD.  hace 10 años;  con sus créditos  ha logrado mejorar su infraestructura comprando cámaras digitales, material fotográficos y registros fotográficos D. mayor calidad. Su sueño es tener un local  dotado D. todo lo que requiere un estudio que genere impacto en sus clientes, por la tecnología y la belleza D. sus diseños. Con su credikiva comprará un kit D. luces look y un lente para la cámara con el cual mejorará aún más  la calidad D. sus fotografías.
texts.en: Rosmery lives in the community of Bellavista in the municipality of Malambo. She has a photography business there and she also provides graphic design services. She studied liberal arts in silkscreen printing and she worked two more years at a supply store and then at another store before she decided to become independent. She used her severance pay to purchase two second-hand cameras and with them she started with her nearest clientele: her parents and friends. Gradually she has managed to expand her territory, from the municipality of Soledad to the city of Barranquilla. For the past 3 years she has been involved with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and it was following a recommendation by her brother, a client enrolled with the organization for 10 years. With her loans she has managed to improve her infrastructure with the purchase of digital cameras, photographic materials, and better quality film. Her dream is to have a store equipped with all that a studio would need to leave a lasting impression on her clients, for the technology and for the beauty of her designs. Her Kiva loan will be used to purchase a lighting kit and a lens for her camera to improve the quality of her photographs even more .

loans.use: to purchase a lighting kit and a lens for her camera.

loans.name: Jossy Roxana

texts.es:
Jossy  tiene 24 años de edad, tiene 1 hijos a su cargo y  vive en casa familiar, junto a su hermana la cual trabaja en forma dependiente.   Su domicilio esta ubicado en el distrito de Castilla  cuenta con los servicios básicos  (agua y luz).


Jossy se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos desde hace 5  años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. Ella se dedica a esta labor diariamente a sábado conoce a la perfección el rubro. cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Jossy se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para ayudar a la economía de su familia. 


Jossy esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles y el destino del crédito será para implemtar su negocio(utensilios e insumos para elaborar sus comidas) y acondicionamiento del negocio.  De esta manera Jossy lograra satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado.
texts.en:
Jossy is 24 years old and has one child in her care.  She lives in her family home together with her sister who works for a company.  Their home is located in Castilla district and has basic services (water and electricity).

Jossy's business is making and selling food.  She has been in this business for five years.  Jossy prepares the food in her home and then sells it to the general public.  She works every day and knows her business to perfection.  She has an already established customer base in the area.

Jossy's business is very popular with her customers owing to the good flavor of her meals.  She uses the profits that she makes from her business to help her family financially.

Jossy is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa and will use the loan money to equip her business with utensils and supplies for making her meals.  In this way, Jossy will manage to meet her customer demand which has increased in recent months.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils to equip her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta  Parroquia es de clima frió, sus bellos paisajes reflejan la belleza natural del sector y desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy trabajadora, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 31, 28, 26 y 24 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su último hijo trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar, tambien cría y vende animales como chanchos, ganado y borregos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad. Trabaja en la agricultura pero lo que siembra es solo para su consumo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y en su alimento.

Su meta es tener mas ganado para la crianza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of the communal bank "San Jose". She lives in the community of Inga Pirca, belonging to the Santa Ana sector. This is known to be a cold climate sector and it is known for the beautiful scenery of natural beauty and from the downtown of the sector a large part of the city of Cuenca can be admired. The population is very hard working and they maintain their culture and their traditions.

Maria is 57 years old, married, and she has 4 children, aged 31, 28, 26, and 24. Her first three children are married and independent. Her youngest child works and he contributes financially. Her husband works in the field of construction and with their combined effort they have managed to build a house of their own.

Maria takes care of the household chores and she also raises and sells livestock, including pigs, cattle, and sheep. She sells them in her own community. She works in agriculture but what she cultivates is for their consumption.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and livestock feed.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y su  menor hijo.  Vive en casa propia, ubicada en caserío Jesús maría, que se ubica a 3 km de cruceta, que es un anexo del distrito de  Tambogrande.  En su domicilio cuentan con servicio de luz pero aun no tiene agua y desagüe.

Benjamín se dedica a  la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas)y aves de corral, los cuales una vez que tiene el peso y tamaño ideal los vende en mercado local. También trabajo como seguridad en una procesadora de fruta y con estos ingresos afronta sus obligaciones familiares. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 01 año. 

Benjamín esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles , dinero con el cual desea comprar  alimento para su ganado y mejoras en su corral  pues espera incrementar sus inventarios y por ende las ventas, para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Benjamín es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 26 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and dependent child.  He lives in his own home, in the small village of Jesús María, 3km from Cruceta, which is an outlying village of Tambogrande district.  He has electricity in his home but does not yet have piped water or sewerage.

Benjamín raises sheep and poultry.  Once they have reached an ideal weight and size, he sells them in the local market.  He also works as a security guard in a fruit processing company.  With the money from these jobs, he faces up to his family obligations.  He has been in his business for more than one year.

Benjamín is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He would like to use this money to buy feed for his animals and to make some improvements to his animal pens since he hopes to increase his stock and, thereby, his sales, so that he can continue growing in his business.

Benjamín is a father who is committed to his family and he always watches over their well-being and development.  People who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to improve his animal pens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foam, steel, acid, and stirrups to make saddles.

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
María  es una madre de familia de 19,  tiene un hijo de 02 años a su cargo y vive en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con casa propia y vive con su esposo. En la zona donde residen las personas se dedican a las labores agrícolas así como al comercio de productos de artesanías. Ésta es una zona rural ubicada a 15 km de la ciudad de Piura, en el camino al distrito de catacaos.

Maria se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida hecha a base de maíz fermentado) esta es una bebida oriunda del Perú,  además vende harina  de maíz, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años en sus mismo domicilio, años en los cuales ella ha podido adquirir clientela fija en su zona.

Maria se ha dado cuenta que  últimamente su clientela se ha visto en aumento,  ella no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender su producto en otras comunidades.  Es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar más insumos como el maíz para la elaboración  de la harina y la chicha.(maiz, azucar,leña), así como para realizar arreglos en la parte donde funciona su cocina, ampliación y techado con calaminas, esta inversión ayudara en la mejora de su calidad de vida , cliente continuará su negocio a fin de seguir creciendo y desarrollando a su familia.

María  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María is a 19 year-old mother.  She has a 2 year-old son in her care and lives in her in-laws' home.  She owns her own home and lives with her husband.  In María's area, people work in agriculture.  They also buy and sell handicrafts.  This is a rural area which is located 15km from the city of Piura, on the road to Catacaos district.

María makes 'chicha de jora' (a drink made from fermented corn).  It is a native Peruvian drink.  She also sells corn flour.  She has been in this business, which she runs from home, for three years.  Over this time, she has acquired regular customers in her area.

María has realised that her number of customers has risen recently.  She does not want to lose the opportunity of selling her product in other communities.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more supplies such as corn for making flour and chicha (corn, sugar and firewood).  She will also make some repairs in her kitchen area, extending it and roofing it with corrugated metal sheets.  This investment will help her to improve her quality of life.  She will continue in her business so that she can continue growing and getting her family ahead.

María is a hard-working and very good-natured woman.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn for making flour and 'chicha' (corn, sugar, firewood)

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es:
Omaira está aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará nuevos productos de belleza y ropa que tiene encargado, pues con su primer credikiva le fué bien y logró aiumentar su capital de trabajo y con ello su clientela que ahora hecho estas solicitudes. 
"Agradezco a todas esas personas que con su granito de arena hoy podemos seguir adelante en nuestros negocios y ver realizados nuestros sueños, que poco a poco vamos a lograr". Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Omaira, por favor ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://www.kiva.org/lend/186296
texts.en:
Omaira will apply her second Kiva loan to the purchase of new beauty products and clothing, for which orders have been laced. Her first loan went well and she managed to increase her working capital and with it her clientele, who have placed these orders.

"I am thankful to those individuals who, thanks to their little grain of sand, have helped us move forward and helped us gradually realize our dreams." 

If you would like to know Omaira's story, please click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/186296

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique vive en el barrio Centro del  municipio de Malambo  con su esposa y dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 12 años; él es un hombre muy responsable de 42 años que ha sostenido su hogar  trabajando independientemente, en un negocio que inició   hace seis años impulsado por un amigo, propietario de un expendio y fue de aquí donde se derivó su emprendimiento; Luis Enrique comenzó vendiendo carnero semanalmente al detal a los vecinos del barrio y a los copropietarios de un edificio, donde prestó el servicio de celaduría  y consiguió muchos clientes a quienes hoy les vende de contado y a crédito a cortos plazos.
Su meta a nivel familiar es  que algún día sus hijos sean profesionales  y su meta empresarial es aumentar su capacidad de compra pues quiere convertirse en mayorista  de ganado   y quiere cuidar su historia crediticia por eso es cauteloso cuando se trata del  pago de sus obligaciones, y está organizándose para poco a poco  conseguir este propósito. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque requiere  adecuar la cubierta de su negocio,  para evitar que la temporada de invierno que ya se avecina,  pueda afectarle su actividad y con este crédito también comprará  carne de cerdo, ganado vacuno y  gallina para la venta pues su mercado ha crecido y diariamente solicita que tengan diversos productos en su oferta, para atraer  a un mayor número de clientes y que estos tengan de donde escoger de acuerdo a sus gustos y cultura alimentaria. 
Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo mediante conexiones con propietarios de fincas y  vendiendo cerdo y gallipava alrededor de su vivienda, con el tiempo se dio a conocer en el sector y ahora no solo vende en el centro de Malambo, sino que en todo el municipio entre restaurantes  y otros clientes que compran al por mayor y con sus ingresos  poco a poco ha organizado su expendio, adicionando un congelador para la conservación de sus alimentos,  con un préstamo que obtuvo con el que logró también enchapar las paredes. Él viaja los fines de semana para hacer las compras  a Cascajal, Ponedera,  Sabanagrande Puerto Giraldo y justamente en estos sitios ha conocido muchos propietarios de fincad, los cuales lo están motivando para comercializar su ganado y a Luis le parece una buena idea aunque planea hacerlo con calma.  Como muestra del alcance de Luis,  su organización y la proyección que tiene,  hace dos años formalizó su microempresa y obtuvo el registro mercantil ante la Cámara de Comercio, para continuar ganando credibilidad en el mercado y oportunidades comerciales superiores a las actuales.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique lives in the community of Centro in the municipality of Malambo. He lives with his wife and their two children, aged 8 and 12. He is a very responsible, 42-year old man who has supported his household by working independently on a business he started six years ago. He was encouraged by a friend, the owner of an outlet, and that is from where he derived his own business. Luis Enrique started out sell ram's meat weekly to his neighbors in the community and to the co-owners of a building where he worked as a security guard. There he earned many clients and he completes his sales in cash and on short-term credit.

His goal for his family is to one day see his children have careers. His goal for his business is to increase his purchase capacity, wanting to convert into a cattle wholesaler. He wants to protect his credit history so he is cautious with his loan payment obligations and his is gradually organizing himself to meet his goal. This Kiva loan is the first loan he has accessed through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he requires it to recondition the roofing on his business, to be ready for the approaching winter season which could affect his business. He will also purchase pork, beef, and chicken meats to resell. His market has grown in the number of clients. He wants to offer them a selection according to their likes and to their gastronomical culture.

He started out his business through connections with owners of farms and by selling pork and turkey meat in his neighborhood. With time he got to know the business and today he not only sells in downtown Malambo, but also at the restaurants and other clients who buy in wholesale in the entire municipality. His profits he has been gradually organizing his store, adding a freezer to conserve his foods. He was also able to refinish the walls with a loan he acquired. He travels on the weekends to make his purchases in Cascajal, Ponedera, Sabanagrande and Puerto Giraldo and it is at these locations that he has gotten to know many farmers. They have been encouraging him to sell their cattle and he thinks it's a good idea, although he plans on taking his time. Given that Luis's goals are within his reach, his organization, and his projection for the future he formalized his business by registering it with Chamber of Commerce. He will continue to earn credibility in the market and to secure better commercial activities.

loans.use: to install a roof on his building.

loans.name: Bonanza (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bonanza esta formado por 7 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, mujeres alegres y carismáticas que se dedican a diferentes actividades para mejorar  económicamente y así salir adelante con  sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza de sus calles y de su centro histórico el mismo que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Mayra vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 27 años, es  casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está en la escuela y el segundo en el prekinder. Su esposo es de profesión militar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Mayra hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, la misma que vende recorriendo  la ciudad, todos los días de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, etc. para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es construir su casa propia.

En la foto nos acompaña una niña que es hija de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Bonanza" is made up of 7 women who are friends and neighbors. They are happy and charismatic women who carry out different business activities to improve financially and to move forward with their families. The members live in different locations in the city of Cuenca. The city is characterized by the beauty of its avenues and by its historical center. It is a mix between colonial and modern and the population retain their culture and traditions.

Mayra S. lives in the downtown area of the city of Cuenca. She is 27 years old, married, and she has 3 children, aged 7, 4, and 2. Her eldest child is in school and the middle child is in preschool. Her husband is a military professional. They don't own a house so they rent where they live.

Mayra has been selling clothing for the past 4 years, traveling throughout the city every day, from Sunday to Sunday, although she does not have a fixed schedule.

She is on her fifth loan with her communal bank and this new loan will be invested in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, kids' clothing, etc., to make her business grow. 

Her goal is to build a house of her own. 

In the photograph she is accompanied by the daughter of one of the other members.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, su esposo es el conductor del carro que esta inscrita en una línea de taxis de su comunidad para recorrer las diversas calles de su ciudad. Su trabajo es de todos los días, empieza desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta la noche. Considera que este negocio le es muy rentable ya que hay mucha demanda de este servicio. Por tal razón cada cierto tiempo lo lleva al mecánico para que le haga su mantenimiento respectivo o cuando lo requiere debe comprar repuestos nuevos. Actualmente posee un auto dos camionetas, en la que sus hijos la conducen ofreciendo el mismo servicio. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP,  es una de las integrantes con mayor antigüedad en su grupo y se ha mantenido durante este tiempo porque ha visto los efectos positivos de pertenecer en un banco comunal por lo que se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la reparación mecánica de su carro.
texts.en: Ida is 46 years old and she lives together with her husband and their 5 children in their own home. For the past 15 years she has been providing public transport services. Her husband is the driver of a car that operates under a line of taxi cabs in the community. She works every day, starting from the very early morning until night time. She considers this business to be very profitable because there is a great demand for this service. For this reason she takes her vehicle to the mechanic for maintenance or when she needs to buy new parts. Currently she has two minivans, driven by her children and providing the same type of service. This is loan number 8 with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is one of the members with the most seniority in her group. She has remained during this time because she has seen the positive impact of being a member of a communal bank. She is committed once again to be on time with her payments. With the loan that she requests she will invest in maintenance repairs to her car.

loans.use: to carry out mechanical maintenance repairs to her car.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy Tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, en casa de la propiedad de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años y medio toca con su propio instrumento en una banda musical, trabaja generalmente los fines de semana porque en esos días se presentan celebraciones y eventos sociales que se dan en su localidad y alrededores. Este trabajo le permite estudiar en la universidad y solventar sus estudios de ingeniería. Disfruta de su trabajo ya que desde muy joven siempre ha tocado  varios instrumentos musicales, en un principio lo tomó como pasatiempo, ya que su sueño es convertirse en un artista, pero ahora lo considera como una fuente principal de vida. Es su crédito número 3 que tiene con MFP, considera que su experiencia de trabajo en un banco comunal le ha permitido mejorar la administración de su dinero por lo que esta agradecido y da su palabra en ser muy responsable en sus pagos como lo ha venido haciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otro instrumento musical.
texts.en: Jimmy is 22 years old and he lives with his parents and siblings in a house that is owned by his parents. He has been playing his own musical instrument with a band for more than four and a half years. He works generally on the weekends because it is during these days that celebrations and social events take place in his community and surrounding areas. This business allows him to go to university and to pay for his engineering studies. He loves his work because since he was very young he has been playing various musical instruments. At first it was only a pass-time and his dream was to be an artist but now he considers it to be his primary source of support. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He says that his experience with a communal bank has helped him improve his financial administration, for which he is thankful. He gives his word to be very responsible with his payments, as he has always done so. With the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of another musical instrument.

loans.use: to purchase a musical instrument.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Adama.  She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 11. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband’s nephews. In 1999 Adama established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to have a means of income that she could use to support her family. Adama's business is open 7 days a week and 11 hours a day.

She needs a loan of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more of her business stock. In the future, Adama plans to expand to the point of importing directly from one of those dress making factories abroad. She wishes to build a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en: This is 33 year-old Maseray.  She is married and has 2 children. In 2005, she established her clothing business in order to fight poverty and to be self-reliant. She uses the proceeds she gets from this business to take care of her children. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,600,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy assorted clothing for her business.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. In the future, Maseray plans to educate her children through university and build a house for her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing for her business.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante (With God in the Lead) 1, 2 & 3, a group made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of  La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. San Pedro de Macoris in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. 

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and three children, and operates a miscellaneous sales business by selling cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business’ inventory. She is excited to received her 4th loan with Esperanza and her group, as with each loan she has been able to improve her business, making it possible for her to provide for her family’s needs and introduce different products to her children.  She says that her most difficult challenge is to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.  She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, etc. for her business

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Foday.  He is single, and has no children.  In 2001, in the outskirts of Freetown city, he established his slippers business because he realized his need to be independent and self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day he earns about SLL 800,000 per month. 

Foday needs a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more bags of different kinds of plastic slippers for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of different kinds of plastic slippers for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and utensils to sell to her cutomers.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelin, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 44  años, tiene dos  hijos que cursan estudios universitarios. 

Evelin  motivada por una vecina  inicio su negocio de cosméticos   dado un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 hace tres  años  en la actualidad  cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes que le permite  obtener  buenas ganancias..


Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  y otros productos a pedido de sus clientes. 
 
Evelin, es una  mujer muy alegre y emprendedora le pone muchas ganas a su negocio es por esta razón que su sueño es  tener boutique,  está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Evelin is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras", located in the district of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, and the Department of San Martin. She is married, 44 years old, and she has 2 children who are in university.

Evelin was motivated by a neighbor to start her own cosmetics business with her initial loan of S/. 300, three years ago. Currently she has a significantly large clientele that provides her a good income. 

With this loan of S/. 800 she will purchase beauty products for her inventory, including perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, skin lotions, compacts, talcs for adults and for babies, lipsticks, nail polish, and other products requested by her clients.

Evelin is a very happy and enterprising woman who expends much effort on her business. Her dream is to have a boutique. She is very thankful with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like her to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as perfumes for ladies and gentlement, skin lotions, compacts, and talc.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl B. is the treasurer of this group. She is 56 and married to a doctor. Together with her husband, she has raised three daughters and a son. The youngest daughter is a student, and the other children are married. Janyl herself works as a teacher in the local high school. Fifteen years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS), the family started breeding cattle. With money gained from reselling cattle, Janyl built a kiosk near the house. She wants to purchase more cattle for breeding, which is why she applied for the loan. In the future, Janyl plans to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstanat http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two teenage children. She owns a small business growing vegetables in greenhouses. Olga has been in this business for 17 years. She’s got five large greenhouses. This business provides her and her family with necessary income as well as vegetables for their own use.

Olga is very entrepreneurial and wants to develop her business further. She would like to purchase a modern watering system that will save water and increase the productivity of her greenhouses. To do so, she needs 10,000 Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH). After raising good crops and making good sales, Olga plans to build one more greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase a modern watering system for the greenhouses that will save water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton, cosmetics, and men's shoes for her business

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Baby. She is married and has three children, ages 19, 16, and 10. She has one additional dependent, who she adopted. In 2008, Baby established her beverage and provision business. She began her business because she dropped out of school. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Baby requires a loan in order to buy more Guinness, stout, soft drinks, and Carlsberg. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for her business

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja is 55 years old, married and has two children. In 1995, she went into business selling wall clocks, household decorations, soap and clothing. She began selling these items to pull herself out of poverty and meet her family's needs. Today she works six days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about Le 1,300,000 a month. She has applied for a loan for Le 5,000,000 to buy more goods to sell to her customers and increase her monthly profits by about Le 300,000. In the future, Haja plans to finish working on her home and pay for the education of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy decorations, soap and clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Alhaji. He is married and has 2 children. In the year 2002, Alhaji established his clothing business. He raised his initial business capital from the sales-assistant work he was doing. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) from this business every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Alhaji requires a loan in order to buy more bales of wax cotton. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 4,000,000. In the future, Alhaji plans to open a retail outlet in another strategic location. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton for his business.

loans.name: Nursiya's Group

texts.en: Nursiya U. is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons and two daughters. The first son works in Russia; the second son is a handicapped person; the older daughter just entered school; and the younger daughter is preschool age (under 7). Eleven years ago, Nurisya collected money (1,500 soms) and purchased three livestock animals for breeding. Since that moment, she has been engaged in livestock breeding. In this way, she earns money to meet the family's needs. With money received from the loan, Nurisya wants to purchase more livestock, and for this purpose, she applied for the loan. In the future, she plans to build a kiosk near the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Saudatu

texts.en:
A single mother of three children, 39 year-old Saudatu established her babies' clothing and powder business in 2006 to provide a livelihood for her children. She operates her business six days a week, ten hours a day.

Saudatu is requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy three cartoons of assorted baby items for her business and in the future plans to have a shop that deals exclusively with baby products. Her main goal is to enable her children to get a quality education. Saudatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of babies' clothing and other baby items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane A. K. is twenty seven and married.  She has four children and she hopes they are able to receive a university level education. 

Jane sells fish at a busy market in Kisumu.  Kisumu is the region of Kenya that includes Lake Victoria, and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.  She has been operating this business for three years, and manages to employ another person.  Jane says the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Jane is using this loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more fish to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes to grow her business and open a hotel where she will serve fish and other types of food.  She describes herself as hardworking, strong and persuasive.

loans.use: To buy more fish to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ladies' bags and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish to grow her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Sixty-two-year-old Ibrahim J., who is a married father of three children, established his bread, tea and provisions business In 2007 in order to earn income to support his family. His business is open 7 days a week for 12 hours each day.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more provisions and hopes that it will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, he plans to build a modern bakery. Ibrahim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as milk, sugar, and margarine for his business.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic K. K. is 32 years old and married to a business lady. They have one child aged one year, whom they hope to give good education to the university level. 

Dominic's business is located at a busy open air market in Nairobi known as Muthurwa. He sells second-hand clothes to the local people. He has been doing this business for five years now. He says that this business is profitable. 

The major challenges he has are financial constraints and the fact that during the rainy season, sales are low since many people do not go to the market. He works very hard to keep his business doing well, however. 

He is using this loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to open a big clothes sales shop in Nairobi. He describes himself as very hardworking, aggressive and caring.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne S. is 35 years old. She is single and has one son, aged 7, whom she plans to give a good education to the university level. 

Carolyne runs a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil, beverages and detergents to the local people. Her business is well known by the name Cashim Enterprise and is located at the busy Khayega market in Kakamega. 

Kakamega is a busy agricultural area known for large-scale production of sugar cane and commonly known as the sugar belt region. 

Carolyne has been running this business for the last three years and has managed to provide employment for one person. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge she faces is the fact that people in the area do not have a lot of money so they do not buy many items thus locking up capital in the slow moving stock. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Carolyne is using this loan of KES 70,000 to buy more general items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business into a big supermarket in future. She describes herself as determined and visionary.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, detergents, beverages etc., for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy R. L. is a 20-year-old married lady. She and her husband have one child, aged 5, whom they wish to give a good education to the university level. 

Her business is located at a busy shopping center known as Kambi in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area well known for production of sugar cane and it is commonly referred to as the sugar belt region.
